DnD 18+ Steel Hearts
Self DM & Mini Encounters / training-hall
ShwiggityShwah 01-Sep-19 09:09 PM
https://i.pinimg.com/564x/d6/a4/e5/d6a4e520a2f4ea07146a0f1dff7d16cb.jpg This Large room is completely empty... but the air sparks with energy, igniting blood lust in those who enter. This is a perfect training ground. There were even Showers on one wall that poured an herbal mixture of pure Life Essence and hot spring mineral water mixed with flexs of green jade. Any injury in the Training Hall can be healed. (edited)
In essence, want to try out a new spell or your mettle against illusionary enemies, or eachother. Have at it!
PENALTY RULES APPLY
ShwiggityShwah 02-Sep-19 09:48 AM
@RoyalUtard Turns out, this room actually fitted the taur quite nicely. There was something... magical about this room, and it reacted to his Wyld magic quite nicely.
RoyalUtard 02-Sep-19 09:14 PM
Inside the room is a warforged Known as A.U.R.I.C. He helps anyone with training or sparring. Any injuries sustained within this room he can heal If you come into this room please tag Asheye as he handles the actions of this NPC. If you don't ic, the room just looks like a large empty metal room. (edited)

Avrae BOT 08-Sep-19 12:50 PM
Asheye Brocktree attacks with a Horns!
Meta
To Hit: 1d20 (2) + 5 = 7 Damage: 1d6 (5) + 3 [piercing] = 8
Effect
Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 {{modifier:str}}, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Asheye Brocktree attacks with a 2-Handed Warhammer!
Meta
To Hit: 1d20 (9) + 5 = 14 Damage: 1d10 (5) + 3 [bludgeoning] = 8
Effect
Proficiency with a warhammer allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

ShwiggityShwah 08-Sep-19 02:46 PM
@Deleted User is lead to a blank vacant room that seems nothing save polished floor and pillars. There seems to be nothing in this room, completely blank. "Well train you here, see if you can handle a few solo scouting missions."
Deleted User 08-Sep-19 02:52 PM
Ada Nods taking a look around, he walks up to a pillar and places his hand on it, and turns his head back to Parcival. He takes his other hand taking the bow off his back. He's holding it at the base with the string pointed upwards. The bow is positioned down by his side, as he takes a few smaller paces over to Parcival he stops and puts his free hand on his hip. "Okay, so what would be the first step then?"
ShwiggityShwah 08-Sep-19 02:54 PM
"Well, think of this as a magic room. For instance." She raises his head and speaks loudly. "I need a forest."
suddenly the room seems to shift before his eyes, he swore he could smell the wood, feel the humidity, and the leaves he was standing in. The pillar he was leaning on became a tree. "So, I'm thinking Is i'll send some monsters to try to find you. You get past them and well, theres going to be a spot for you on the Heart."

Avrae BOT 08-Sep-19 08:07 PM
Adaroros Iranerah casts Hunter's Mark!
Meta
Effect: Marked
Effect
Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target whenever you hit it with a weapon attack, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find it. If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to mark a new creature.
Spell Slots
1 ◉◉〇

zzo 19-Sep-19 04:39 PM
It had been a few days since Zzo'olo had been extracted from Pioneer, only to hear he'd be going back come booming over the ship's loudspeaker. A wry smile mars his face, the irony surprisingly not lost on him today, as he enters the holodeck for some much needed training. He'd felt himself slipping, busied by the general goings on and his indelibly libido fueled misadventures. Now at last there was the opportunity to get his blood pumping in the way he was most familiar, and so he sets to exploring this new place.
zzo 20-Sep-19 10:03 AM
Zzo'olo wasn't exactly this structure was that he'd happened upon, but it was sturdy enough to support his weight. And so, after some stretches and light calisthenics, he'd taken to hopping up and doing one-armed pull-ups. "Weird gym..." He thought aloud, pulls himself up smoothly, "No weights anywhere...", then drops back down and repeats. (edited)
RoyalUtard 20-Sep-19 02:45 PM
As Zzo'olo looked around, he would see a warforged in the corner looking at a number of floating screens, and would know this is the NPC attendant for this room. (edited)
@zzo
zzo 20-Sep-19 02:56 PM
Jarred by his sudden realization that the warforged was actually here, Zzo'olo would call out to it amicably. "Oh, Allo there mate!" He drops to the floor, landing on his boots with a heavy thud, and approaches. "'Ope ya don't mind I took over ya chin-up bar over there for a bit." The nearly 500 pull-ups he'd knocked out had given him a glossy sheen. He puts his hands on his hips and looks at the floating screens sidelong. "Whatcha got there?" (edited)
RoyalUtard 20-Sep-19 03:09 PM
Auroc gave a confused look,"That is not a Chin-up bar, that is a pipe that pumps hot water. If you neede to generate a module for you, I would be happy to. But first, let me introduce myself, I am A.U.R.I.C. As the the trio enter the room in their various ways, A.U.R.I.C., Automated Unitary Respondant Interactive Construct, Please state your name and Class." (edited)
((Zzo'olo takes 26 points of fire damage for not knowing how this room works))
1
zzo 20-Sep-19 03:14 PM
Zzo'olo's face slowly shifts from pleasantly cheerful to throughly perplexed at the onslaught of complicated words. "You wat mate?" He turns around and looks at the bar; on second thought, it didn't look like what he'd presumed it was after all. Zzo'olo resumes facing Auric. "I uh, my name's Zzo'olo...and lotsa folk keep callin me a barbarian, but I don't think I'm that bad..." He scratches at his cheek as he tries to argue his case and save face.
RoyalUtard 20-Sep-19 03:17 PM
Auric nodded, and dismissed the three screens he was looking at, then cast minor illusion to create another, which he recorded Zzo'olo's information on,"Based on your initial statement, it sounds like you want a Static Training Module with exercise equipment, is that correct? (edited)
zzo 20-Sep-19 03:23 PM
"Uhhh," Zzo'olo took a moment, then hones in on the words he understands. "Yea! Trainin, excersize! Stuff like that. One question though," He holds up his finger to ask for a pause, "Whassa mod duel? That like--some special kinda duel?"
RoyalUtard 20-Sep-19 03:29 PM
Auroc extended his hand and a metal column rose up out of the floor,"Modules are the simulated training environments that I am able to create with hard light constructs. You could be anywhere," he said as he begain pressing a number of buttons on the column,"A gym, a forest, inside a castle." He said as the room changed to each thing he listed,"I can also recreate any entity you may wish to fight. Just tell me what it is you want to train against."
zzo 20-Sep-19 03:42 PM
Zzo'olo whistles, clearly impressed by all the fancy gadgetry. His places his hands solidly on his hips and thinks a moment. "--Anywhere versus any thing eh? Neva been too good at choosin 'tween one thing er anotha..." This all resembled high magic to him. "Say--you must be pretty tough, seein as 'ow you can summon all this an wat not. Howz about a wrassle, jus you an me." He thumbs into his own chest. "Whaddya think? Must be boring, lookin at them float'y things all day?"
RoyalUtard 20-Sep-19 06:54 PM
"I am made to heal, not to fight, however, I think I have an appropriate solution." The warforged said, pressing a few buttons on his console, then 4 copies of Auric appeared 30 feet from zzo'olo,"You can fight artificial copies of me, that way my abilities to run modules and heal are not impeded."
zzo 20-Sep-19 07:27 PM
Zzo'olo was already cracking his knuckles and moving some paces away from Auric and toward his clones as the automaton was still finishing his explanation. "Now~ yer talkin... Though I think ya might be overestimatin me." Zzo'olo stands statuesque, opposed the Auriclones, hands balled into fists and hanging down at his sides. "Awright mate, ready when you are." Zzo'olo levels his gaze on all four at once; a technique he'd learned from an old cavalier friend. Ironically enough, the technique is called 'soft eyes'.
RoyalUtard 21-Sep-19 11:46 AM
@zzo from here just rp the fight, I'm kind of busy and can't run an encounter atm))
1
zzo 21-Sep-19 11:47 AM
You got it))
zzo 21-Sep-19 12:45 PM
But that was as soft as it got. Before the Auriclones could make a move, Zzo'olo takes the initiative lurching forward from a dead stand-still. His toes sound off on the floor a few times, skin crackling as his muscles bulge underneath; rage engaged. "--Tha safe word," He he calls out to them, then launched himself at the quadre, flying fast and arms and legs splayed wide, "--is Mod-duel!" He shouts mid-flight, then unceremoniously crashes into the lot of them with a cacophony of metal ringing in the chamber. The sound of rending metal and heavy hits against flesh, bone, and plate ensued for all of about ten minutes, until only one figure stood victorious. Zzo'olo held an errant automaton leg grasped in his hand, the frayed ends sparking with the magic force that gave it life. A line of blood had streamed down from his eyebrow, and dried to a near black where it hadn't mixed with his sweat. He wore a grim looking smile, shoulders slowly moving up and down as he caught his breath. "That...was prett'y damn good..." He says with his chalky voice through the grin, then the light leaves his eyes and he drops into the pile of savaged Auriclones.

zzo 23-Sep-19 02:16 PM
As the module ended, and the room regained its barren normalcy, Zzo'olo blinks awake. Good news comes from Auric, and he rises one leg at a time, straightens out his garb. "Blood'y good scuffle mate!" He extols, giving Auric a strong and friendly clap on the shoulder. "I'll come back inna few days, and we try five. Sound good?" He was already walking away, waving lazily over his shoulder, but definitely had a contented smile on the other side. Zzo'olo exits the holodeck, and goes for some post fight protein. Maybe something smoked, if they had it aboard. Exit
ShwiggityShwah 30-Sep-19 10:34 AM
AURIC had set the training hall into a typical gladitorial fighting pit, the Warforged standing by with a pair of trainer trunks and boxing gloves as @Rhost and @NervousNoobz were prepped to enter the ring.
"How we doing this?" He asked in his rough tone. "Bloodied, submit, or penalty?"
Rhost 30-Sep-19 10:39 AM
Rex was eyeing the arena. He wasn't used to not fighting in a crowded arena. This would be a new experience for him. He looked at his opponent and tried to read her but failed. She was an enigma to him. Her fighting style a puzzle that he will eventually find a solution to. He doubted today would be any different than before tho. "Either works for me." his voice was deep, as if that of a military commander. (edited)
NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 10:58 AM
Newt walked into the arena with her usual confident stride. She wore oversized eastern clothes, a souvenir from some sucker who thought he would take out the little wolf. She wore a hood to hide her canine ears and wrapped her tail around her waist like a fuzzy belt. And she had a quiver of bow and arrows on her back but strangely not bow to speak of. On her hip she hand various random trinkets such as ornate door handles, what appeared to be a fancy chair leg and other random items. She cracked her knuckles as she walked in and snickered at the warforge's comment. "We fight until the other goes down. K.O. That the only spars i do." She looked over at the large human man and the second her eyes fixed on his face her heart dropped into her stomach Fuck she recognized him from her days as a gladiator, days she would rather forget and didn't want anyone to find out. Yet this man knew her then. She needed to make sure he kept his mouth shut. Newt pretended not to know the man and just walked towards the center of the ring. "You ready pretty boy"
Rhost 30-Sep-19 11:00 AM
He walked in after her, adjusting the vambrace on his right forearm. He cracked his neck side to side and assumed a boxing stance. "Yes."
NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 11:02 AM
//start 30ft apart?
Rhost 30-Sep-19 11:02 AM

Avrae BOT 30-Sep-19 11:02 AM
@Rhost :game_die: Initiative: 1d20 (18) Total: 18

The made her hood fall as her ears pop out as well as her tail which unwounded from her waist and wiggled back and forth. Rhost 30-Sep-19 12:35 PM

He didn't know why he didn't stand up to himself against her. He turned around and stepped out of the shower,shaking his hair left and right,before running a hand through it to get it out of his face. "Rex. Rex Invictus. That's what the crowd called me."
NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 12:40 PM

Gent 08-Oct-19 10:27 AM
The 6'2" tall blonde man, called Lucas walked inside of the training hall in the early morning, having most of his weapons with him. He has only recently finished healing up from his recent mission, and he was quite eager to spend is pent up energy on doing something productive. This time however, one thing was different. He has purchased a nice, dark set of enchanted studded leather armor, which felt sort of different than the one he had one before, meaning that it wasn't something he was used to, and now he was looking around to see what he could use for training, thinking about where the training dummies might be, as it was probably too early for any sane person other than him to start training already
@NervousNoobz (sry, I'm not that great with openers)
NervousNoobz 08-Oct-19 10:30 AM
(What are you talking about that was good!)
NervousNoobz 08-Oct-19 10:38 AM
I loud yawn echoed through the hall leading to the training area before a very short woman walked out from the entrance. She wore oversized eastern clothes. Her eyes where a piercing red, coated with a thin layer of water from the tears that formed during her yawn. Her hair was long and silver and pulled back into pony tail that was covered by a hood that also hide her canine ears. Her fluffy wolf like tail was wrapped around her waist to make the appearance of a fuzzy belt. And she had a quiver of bow and arrows on her back but strangely not bow to speak of. On her hip she had various random trinkets such as ornate door handles, what appeared to be a fancy chair leg and other random items. She looked over to the tall man while rubbing the morning exhaustion from her eyes. "Your a new one." she eyes him up and down before yawning again "Yelp you don't look like much but let see what you can do"
Gent 08-Oct-19 10:51 AM
Lucas watched the tired, strange looking woman walking into the training hall as he was inside, shrugging in a flustrated way after she said that he didn't look like too much "Again, why do people assume that one needs to be all buffed out to be good at- Nevermind..." He managed to calm himself down a bit, releasing a sigh now, and soon the man tilted his head to the side a bit, giving her a somewhat charming, and friendly smile while extending a hand towards her "My name's Lucas... It's nice to meet you..." She could now see that there was a shortsword hanging on his side, and that he also had a quiver with arrows, though he had a shortbow on him right now, as well as a pair of daggers, though they weren't visible right away
NervousNoobz 08-Oct-19 01:05 PM
Newt examined the man weapons as he extended a hand to her. Thinking all the possibilities his skills might be. Short sword, daggers, arrows. Slender but muscular frame. She guessed her was more agile then strong and took note. She reached out and grabbed his hand, gripping it much harder then she intended. He would feel a surprising amount of force behind the small woman's grip as she shook his hand "The name is Newt. So we doing this?"
Gent 08-Oct-19 01:37 PM
As Newt shook his hand, Lucas frowned painfully at her firm grip, trying to grip back at hers as much as he could, though she was obviously a lot stronger than him in that subject, making him rather relieved after seeing that she didn't completely crush his hand when they stopped shaking hands. Then, trying to disperse what just happened, he gave her a playful smile before replying to her "Hmm, Newt is a cute name~... But I guess that's fitting for someone like you, doesn't it?" The blonde man said it in a tone that was intended to charm her more or less, before nodding a bit "Sure, we can get started soon, just a quick question... Is any form of magic going to be allowed?" Gent 08-Oct-19 02:22 PM
After hearing her response, he calmly rubbed his chin for a few seconds, now thinking to himself about how to reply "Hey, I don't need any magic to be charming, so don't worry about that one~..." he said it with a mischievous smile on his face before drawing out his sword. This was it, he was going to fight in his new armor for the first time. He barely knew anything about his opponent now, but he guessed that she had some tricks in her hands, though Lucas wasn't the one to lack those either Then, as she was far away from him enough that they could start their battle, he had a quick countdown in his head before starting to rush towards her, making it clear that he wouldn't mess around too much in the battle. Once he was close enough to her, he used the momentum of his speed to attack her once with a sword, but instead of just stopping here... With the same move of his torso, he pulled out a dagger from his belt, trying to get a sneaky scratch in there, though he made sure to not to hit any vital organs of her, since he wanted to continue charming, and perhaps impressing her

Newt grin widened as a low growl would start to manifest from her chest. As it did he would see her body almost pulse before hearing the cracking of bone. From her skin would start to grow grey and white fur as her mouth extended into a snout. The unnerving cracking and shifting hose of bones and muscles morphing would echo as Newt grew from her short 4'11 statue to a large more muscular and voluptuous bestial form. She would start into his eyes like a predator around to attack its prey as her grin flashed her sharp and long canines. But instead of attacking Newt seem to tense up and take a defensive pose "Go ahead boy, show me what you got" her voice was deeper more sultry and carried a constant growl to it

Avrae BOT 08-Oct-19 03:41 PM
Error: spell_name is a required argument that is missing. Use !help cast for help.
Lucas casts Color Spray!
Description
A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Roll 6d10; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can effect. Creatures in a 15-foot cone originating from you are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures and creatures that can't see). Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell is blinded until the end of your next turn. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.
Spell Slots
1 ◉◉〇
No spell automation found.

Do you have any ideas about what you'd make me do? Maybe a proper backrub to make up for all the pain I caused?" Lucas was now back to his usual, charming tone which he almost always used when talking to women, though he didn't really think of Newt in a lewd way despite her curves, especially after having her as an opponent before

Irithriel, hand in hand with her Mors, entered the training hall for the very first time. The room seemed so very big, their footfalls echoing throughout the place. She looked up at Mors and gulped nervously. “I... I’m a bit scared,” she admitted with a soft giggle. What good would she be for her beast’s noble cause if she couldn’t fight by his side? It would take work. But it was work she was willing to do.

Mors | Garg | Bof 17-Nov-19 10:22 AM
The robot/ghost nodded and addressed the group, "Firstly, my name is Cassius Clay, I am in charge of the guild, or as some of you know me by, the guild master" said the polite robot with a small bow, " Secondly, I apologise for springing this little test on you, I was in talks whith an old acquaintance from the deep sea and we had a little idea to test the new batch of recruits, it was possible thanks to Mr. DreadStorm presence here," He said while gesturing towards the angry sharkin, "Now I applaud our not so new members, Mr. DreadStorm, Miss Opitant, that was an exemplary display of The Steel Hearts ideals, first and foremost we are a family, the purpose of this little event was to test our members ability to rely on their teammates, once again, Me. DreadStorm, Miss Opitant, well done, even whithout knowing each other you showed what should be the expected behavior of our members." He finished with a small tip of his hat towards them. "Now for our new recruits, Please learn to rely on each other and focus on the general situation, you showed valor and courage facing off the enemies without hesitation but forgot to guide the leaderless crew, there will be quite a few situations where your actions affect directly other lives apart from yours, so be mindful of that, still very well done." Then he addresses the unexpected arrival, "Mr. Lodewijick, your are the image of an old friend, please, welcome to our guild and if you have any questions don't be afraid to ask me, abut your performance, that was a good thinking, but please, next time check the whole vehicle for any innocent lives before destroying completely the place." He finished with another small bow towards the barbarian.
Mr. Cassius raised his arms in a T pose, his cane being held in his right hand, "Finally, welcome to The Steel Hearts, please, explore the ship to your hearts content, and my door will be always open to you, and I am sure that M.r Tower's training hall will warmthly receive any member wanting to improve themselves." He finished the introduction, and lowered his arms again, testing both of his hands on top of the cane and started to wait for any questions or concerns. Surprisingly they adventurers could feel their strength resturning, wounds being healed by the water and only leaving small bruises on their skin as a reminder of their failures.

Saulrhema 17-Nov-19 02:31 PM
Séarlas stands up and Looks directly at Lyralei whith a slightly angered expression on his face and proceeds to tell her why he blew the ship up "I might have enjoyed blowing the ship up,but I didn't do it because it was fun,I did it to survive and to be able to save all of you,the ship was getting heavy damage by the pirate canons,I had to make sure to disable them to protect the crew on the ship you were in,also to end with the threat that the enemy crew represented. Blowing the pirate ship up,it was the best course of action in my mind,even,even if it meant!...potentially putting other lives at risk or killing innocent slaves in the cargo,but I had no time to spare. Spending time to search the whole pirate ship for people who might or might have not been there would have putted too much lives at risk specially mine as I would have to fight my way around the unknown pirate ship alone,so I focused on the lives who I was completly certain existed and were at risk,even if I found innocent people there,would have I been able to save them? or if I tried to escape with them,would I have been able to protect them from the pirates? At most I would have gotten them a few seconds,besides I didn't know if they knew or were able swim on the first place..." Castle stops for a moment and after taking a long breath to calm himself he said in a serious but devoid of anger tone as to show Lyralei that he wasn't angry at her "In conclusion there was too much risk,it was too much of a gamble,and the lives of the people on your ship,even yours,were on the line,so I made my choice,knowing that there might have been dire consequences,I wasn't omniscient to know how the fight was going and wanted to make sure you guys survived" Castle then took another deep breath and offered his hand to her to help her stand up as he presented himself again as he didn't catch her name before "My name is Séarlas Lodewijik" (edited)

Saulrhema 18-Nov-19 12:33 PM

I am not going to loose easily you know?"He chuckled again"Sounds interesting,do you have any idea regarding the type of competition? well we can always think about it when we have to cross that bridge,for now are you ready for the fight or want to change any of the rules?"He asked her

Saulrhema 18-Nov-19 01:03 PM
Séarlas's battle insticts kick in and he immediatly puts an inmense ammount of strength on his legs to be able to move 30ft in an instant,making the ground under his feet quake with every step he made,he appeared just in front Lyralei covering her completly with hos shadow"Yo!"He greeted her casually as he raged and his muscles,no,his whole body appeared to increase a bit,he then exploited the surge of strength and the window of oportunity by recklessly slashing at her with his longsword
Blood splattered on the ground,wverything happened too fast,if Lyralei looked at her belly she could see that he managed to slice her,leaving an inmense cut on it as his sword moved at a speed that was almost imperceptible to the eye (edited)

The last thing that she felt, was her body falling forward directly aiming at the floor. Winds of Hope 18-Nov-19 07:17 PM
Ippo 30-Nov-19 01:05 AM
After a bit of wandering and investigation, Riwo comes upon the training hall in his search for Bis. This is his first time here, and had expected a normal sparring room.
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 01:09 AM
Bis is punching a sack of sand, almost the size of a person. Whomp Whomp Whomp Left right, cross, punch punch punch. He snarling and snapping and talking to himself, his big body heaving and getting coaxed with a fine sweat as he worked out. He seemed unfocused on the world around him...
Ippo 30-Nov-19 01:11 AM
Upon spotting him, Riwo sighs through his nose. The trick will be approaching him. "Bis," he calls as he comes nearer.
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 01:16 AM
Bis stops the bag. Looks at him, snarls, then goes back to the bag. Hitting it harder. "What do you want? Bright Morning need her toothbrush?" He really lays into bag now, almost exhausting himself.
Ippo 30-Nov-19 01:18 AM
Riwo moves behind the bag to hold it steady with his weight as Bis lays into it. "I came to apologize. You were right. I got worked up and mistook consideration for my own feelings for yours. I'm sorry."
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 01:22 AM
The apology gives him pause. It was noticable, but he then hits the bag a little bit, hard at first, but then kind of eases off. "Apology- umph..." He growls, thinking for a moment before he gives the bag a near miss almost skimming Riwo's shoulder.
He stops to breath. "Accepted."
Ippo 30-Nov-19 01:25 AM
Riwo smiles at this small triumph, even if he almost got punched for it. "Thank you. I think you're as much of a victim here as Bright, and in my arrogance I didn't see it. I feel like I should get to know you better, if that's alright."
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 11:08 AM
"Hahaha, Victim." He says before going over to a basin of cool spring water is filled to the brim. "What gave you that crock?" He drinks from a cup of water, the water trickling down his muzzle. "Just know where I'm coming from. Dont play head games. I know you missionary types."
Ippo 30-Nov-19 11:13 AM
Riwo follows him to the basin, filling another cup to hand to Bis when he wants it. "No games. I understand where you're coming from. Look at me." He holds his arms out as if displaying his strange mix of androgynous and fiendish features. "I know what it's like to be shunned. You and people you know had bad experiences with the Church, and I get that. If you don't mind, maybe you can tell me a little more about yourself."
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 07:49 PM
He took her cup and downed it as well. Growing boy. And he made a good point. Both would know that Tieflings and Beastkin were the subject of racism. Beastkin for the behavior of their monster kin, and Tieflings... most of them tracing their blood to fiends rather then fey or elementals. The church welcomes fiends, teaches them, offering sanctuary, because though Hell is home, no one desires to be there. There was a moment of contemplation. Before he spoke. "Yeah, that's always the question. Whats your story?" he went to a rack nearby with a towel. "Want a surprise. I dont have one. A bastard to a captured gnoll that some trapper musta raped. Enslaved to a nobles house to do the hard labor, until I was given to serve a brothel with a half decent Madame. The brothel went under and me and the other freak that was there struck out on our own."
Ippo 30-Nov-19 07:57 PM
Riwo insists on taking the towel, and if it's given, he'd wipe Bis down for him until satisfied. He seems genuinely crestfallen at the story. "I'm sorry that happened to you. And here I am judging you and scolding you. I feel ashamed."
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 11:19 PM
He gave him a look as he raised his arms, walked around. It was intimate. It was weird. Felt weird. But he didn't complain. "I dont need pity. Shit happens. You learn to rely on yourself. You probably have some examples too. I don't need to hear it." He crossed his arms, bristling a little bit as he remembered their exchange. "I dont hit Bright Morning. She's like a sister to me." There's other ways to abuse people though.
Ippo 30-Nov-19 11:21 PM
(Did Bis let Riwo wipe him, or was that him walking away from it?
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 11:25 PM
//he is wiped
//which is awkward and weird
Ippo 30-Nov-19 11:25 PM
( >:3
Riwo hums in agreement. He knew better than to totally peg him for innocent, since something toxic was definitely going on between him and Bright, but Riwo was there to heal, not punish. "Do you think maybe you're doing to her what I've done to you? Maybe you're mistaking your own anger and indignation for hers." While speaking, Riwo kept close to Bis.
ShwiggityShwah 01-Dec-19 01:57 PM
"Is that what you call protecting?" He had to think a little bit about that, mostly cause he had to think what he was getting at. "I'm a gnoll. I have my bark and my bite when I have to deal with bullshit."
Ippo 01-Dec-19 02:01 PM
"But Bright is not a gnoll. She can't handle that bark and bite like you can." Riwo's hand hovers over Bis' arm as if waiting for his permission to touch him. "I'm not accusing you of anything, but I know a scared person when I see one."
ShwiggityShwah 01-Dec-19 02:16 PM
Bis didn't recoil, but there was a tension there. He shrugged it off. "Don't worry about it. She's always been a little skiddish. I deal with the big problems so she doesnt have to worry about it. She should be fine by the time you see her again. She's just like that. Always was trying to toughen her up a little bit."
Ippo 01-Dec-19 02:20 PM
If Bis wasn't going to stop him, Riwo would place his hand on his arm. "When was the last time you were gentle with her? How often do you tell her how much you appreciate her for who she is and what she does for you? I don't think you're a bad person, and I know you genuinely care about Bright, but a lot of that care seems to be clouded by bitterness and fear. Is that what you want between you two?"
ShwiggityShwah 01-Dec-19 02:36 PM
"UUhhh?" He began, his nose turning up as he looked away. He didn't recoil from Riwo. If anything he seemed used to it, once he got used to it. It harbored back to what he said before. He was a prostitute himself, probably harboring to the big muscular alien tastes of clients. "She knows." He finally admits. But not giving a follow up. He turned to her. "Hey, I ain't afraid of nothing. And I aint bitter. What's there to be bitter about?" He was dodging.
Ippo 01-Dec-19 02:46 PM
Riwo's hand clenches the fur on Bis' arm--not hard, though. "Bis, friend, is it okay if I give you a hug?"
ShwiggityShwah 01-Dec-19 02:51 PM
He kept keeping Bis off balance. Bis was getting kinda weirded out but it was in such a gentle way that he couldn't really stay mad. "Why?" He asked, trying to find some kind of reason behind it. Why did this guy seem to want to get to know him so well.
Ippo 01-Dec-19 02:53 PM
"I want to show you what affection looks like." Riwo's voice shook just a teensy bit, as though holding in strong emotions.
ShwiggityShwah 01-Dec-19 03:05 PM
It was a strong reaction and even he was put off balance. He opened his arms and gave a sigh... Riwo's empathy would note that Bis seemed to be a little, embarrassed that he was letting it happen. He didn't look at Riwo, but the hug was aloud, and as expected, he'd be warm, but hard, fur over muscle, and if he did, arms would go around him as well. It seemed natural, instinctual.
Ippo 01-Dec-19 03:11 PM
Riwo wraps his arms around Bis' much more imposing form as best he can. His face is almost buried in the fur of his chest. "O-oh, wow, okay. You're really warm and cozy." He holds the hug, looking like he's trying to keep himself from crying. "I respect you as a person, and I'm sorry if I made you feel like less of one. It's okay if you're not feeling good. Your friends are there to help. I'm here to help. You are not unmanly for seeking help or expressing love like this."
ShwiggityShwah 02-Dec-19 09:01 AM
"Thanks." He said kinda proudly as his arms went around him. It was an impulse, sometimes clients liked to cuddle, and being wrapped up in fur can be considered a fun time, no sex required. Bis immediately starts talking. "Whoa whoa whoa. Are you crying? I told you its not a big deal." He puts his hands on Riwo's shoulders. "Seriously it isn't a big deal."
Ippo 02-Dec-19 09:07 AM
Riwo sniffles, and then tears well up in his eyes. His voice is shaky with them. "Thank you," he says, and presses his face into Bis' chest. "Would you come back so that you and Bright can talk together?"
ShwiggityShwah 02-Dec-19 10:32 AM
He offers him the towel... and actually catches the tears for him wiping his face. Bis apparently can be gentle, hardly becoming but maybe Riwo woke up some kind of mother hen instinct. "Yeah- yeah its fine. Jeez, stop crying already its embarrassing."
Ippo 02-Dec-19 10:36 AM
Riwo laughs and leans into the hand wiping his face. "Okay, okay. Thank you." He touches Bis' hand. "That's what affection looks like. Now, come on. Let's show Bright how good you are."
ShwiggityShwah 02-Dec-19 11:07 AM

Ippo 02-Dec-19 11:18 AM

(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 08-Dec-19 07:05 PM
"Aye, aye. Just one piece'a advice to go;" He takes on a more serious expression, and his accent seems to vanish. "Don't listen to every rumor you hear. There are arenas that put on 'show-fights', certainly, but actual combat displays are still a common occurrence. And just because I'm willing to calm down and point out the distinction, doesn't mean every arena fighter you may come across will be." With his piece said, he takes a breath, seeming to retake his original, bravado-laden attitude in the process, and goes back to what he was doing prior to her arrival. “Oh thank you so much for your advice, I’ll try my best to remember.” she said sarcastically, not really pleased with the mans attitude, having a hard time deciding if he was being rude or just had a hard time communicating
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 08-Dec-19 10:18 PM
The goliath rolls his eyes as he continues his workout. "Jus' offerin' my point of view, lass! Not sure you would enjoy having your line o' work and the effort you put into it called 'fake', aye? Or did you convince yerself that you weren't bein' rude by sayin' that?"
Jazzy(';~;')Waifu 09-Dec-19 10:52 AM
“Aye I’m not being rude, most gladiatorial and arena fights are fake. Sure they get hurt, cuts and bruises but rarely does one die, at least in the official matches. Each one of you cost a lot for a sponsor to well sponsor and having someone die every match ain’t exactly economical for them.” she spoke with a clear educated voice, one that spoke with maturity and experience
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 09-Dec-19 05:17 PM
He takes a moment, rolling her words through his mind, before ultimately shrugging. "Hmph. So, 'fake' in your eyes is none of us dyin'? Well, aye, the goal is generally not to murder the guy across from ya while ya beat 'im bloody, and we got paid and healed at match's end... But in the moment o' the fight, that don't do much when you're trying to brawl through blood, broken bones, an' that career-killer known as the concussion."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Dec-19 12:28 AM
Irithriel slowly walked towards the door leading into the training halls. It was a place she knew... her feelings about it rather mixed, though she fully understood its importance. The girl tugged on a lock of white and glanced over her shoulder to see if any of her new friends had followed. If they had, they’d see her quietly enter and just politely stand off to the side, while watching some people finish up what appeared to be a friendly sparring match. She bit down on her lip, while she waited, not wanting to interrupt, but wanting to spread the word about her need for aid to rescue her love, her mate, her Mors.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 10-Dec-19 12:31 AM
Nope, no spar here. Just an argument that Jonny was more than happy to have an easy out from. He turns to the newcomer, looking her over before striding up to meet her. "Ah, another one... Don't think I know ya, pleased to make your acquaintance. Jonny Alpha, at your service." He laxly offers a hand to Irithriel, giving her a charming smile to go with it.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Dec-19 12:52 AM

(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 10-Dec-19 12:57 AM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Dec-19 01:03 AM
Iri just blushed and nodded her snowy head, white curls swishing about her face. “Not usually, no,” she admitted. “Though I’ve sparred once for my Mors.” The girl’s expression went distant for a moment as she remembered that day they’d fought the wood dragon. “But you’re right. She was beyond happy that some of her guild mates wanted to help her get Mors back. Their gesture of kindness said it all to her and, as such, she’d be forever grateful.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 01:23 AM
When they reached the training hall, Sela’s golden eyes went wide. This was the first time she’d been there, as she was still learning the ship. The room was large, a vast open space ready to accommodate any type of fight. Fight? No. She looked at Bofwant, that heat still making her cheeks rosy. No, this was sparring. Training. They’d help each other improve, so they could be more effective later. “Oh my...”’Sela whispered, before stepping in further. She turned to Bofwant and smiled up at him. “Well, I’m ready any time you are.”

Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 06:12 AM
Bofwant smiled back at Sela and unsheated his sword, he had his shield ready too, "Very well Miss Sela, I'll go and talk to the Battle Master and set up a simulation, wait for me here.." He told her and went to the far side of the room to talk with a Warforged that was doing some paperwork in a desk. After talking with Iron Tower and setting up the perfect scene to learn to work together, Bofwant returned to Sela's side, "Everything is ready, Miss Sela, I warn you that this scene might trigger you, but I am not doing this to make you hurt but to help you face your fears, remember I am here with you now, you can lean on me and If it gets too much for you please just say so and I will stop this immediately." He told her as the room around them warped little by little. They found themselves in the middle of a Town, it was midnight but the streets were iluminated by the full moon so they could see clearly what was going on.... A gang of thugs were besting the shit out of an innocent Guard. (edited)
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 09:46 AM
Bofwant looked at the situation and had an idea, "Come here, I'll help you to get up to those roofs so they can't see you... I'll make a distraction so the focus will be on me and you can ambush them..." He told her quickly as he walked towards the wall and prepared to push her up.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 10:00 AM
Sela nodded, as Bofwant readied to hoist her up the wall. Her breaths were starting to quicken, the anticipation of battle causing her adrenaline to surge. With a simple push, she was easily able to get on top of the wall. She glanced down at Bofwant and gave him a smile, then looking towards the group, she slipped into those ever calling shadows, letting them engulf her, as they tended to do. Once safely hidden, she crept closer to the scuffle, keeping an eye on what was happening, as well as where Bofwant was.
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 10:15 AM

His shield expanded a little, glowing with holy energy and his sword started to shine so brightly that he started to iluminate the place.
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 10:32 AM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 10:44 AM
Sela bit down on her lip, as she watched Bofwant shout out and move closer to the thugs. He was glowing like a beacon of light, undoubtedly gaining all of those thugs’ attention. So, sticking to the plan they’d briefly discussed, she crept forward along the wall and set her sights on the one closest to her. He was clearly thinking that he and his buddies had the upper hand, but she wasn’t about to let him or any of them harm Bofwant or further harm the guard. Sucking in a sharp breath, she held up her bow and nocked an arrow. Golden eyes finding their focus, she let the arrow go, watching it hit its target. With a small smile, she remained in the shadows, hoping to remain hidden from this group of horrible men.
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 10:58 AM
The guard kept holding on... Thug1 fired his crossbow to the incoming Paladin and missed Thanks to the bright light shining directly into his eyes, then he heard a scream and turned around, thug4 had an arrow sticking out of his chest, he tried to look from where it came from but there was only darkness and he was still a little blinded by the light...
Bofwant rushed forward and holding his sword with his shield hand for a second he took a javelin from his back and threw it at the screaming thug. The projectile went through his head and killed him instantly.
The other thugs noticed the commotion and stopped hitting the guard, they turned around and fired at the bright light, thug3's bolt was blocked by Bofwant's shield and thugh2 crossbow broke in his hands, "Arrrggg" he screamed in frustration...
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 11:20 AM

She slowly breathed in and out and in again, trying to hold onto her calm. Bofwant was out there. And so was an innocent guard. She couldn’t falter now, just like she never would when it was her twin. Moving forward, yet making sure to remain hidden, Sela focused on a thug right next to the guard. And once more, she attempted to stay hidden, so as to best help Bofwant and the poor guard.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 01:27 PM
Sela’s mind raced, as she watched Bofwant suddenly get surrounded. Her thoughts went dark, screams inside her head urging her on, to help him, to do her best. And she would! The girl crept forward just a bit more, preferring to not stay still for too long out of fear that these horrible men might discover her whereabouts. When she stopped, she aimed at the already injured thug. Taking a moment, she shut her eyes. When she opened them, she let the arrow go, watching it move through the air until it hit its target squarely in the chest. The man screamed and then crumpled to the ground. He wouldn’t be any further trouble in this battle. She looked to Bofwant hoping he was all right, her thoughts desperately wishing him luck, while every nerve in her body remained on alert. Still watching the scene, she did her best to remain concealed in the shadows, those darker corners that had always provided her safety.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 01:58 PM

As the heat swept down along her skin, she moved forward and took aim, her arrow gliding through the night air and finding its mark with ease. Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 02:15 PM
Sela felt the onset of panic, as she watched Bofwant take blow after blow. The girl closed her eyes, hoping that he was all right, that he wasn’t in too much pain. Bringing herself back to the moment, she then aimed her arrow and let it go. It zipped across the sky and struck the thug in the side. It was obvious he was hurting more than Bofwant and that was what she needed to remain calm. Still, her breaths were coming faster, her heart pumping hard with fear. Licking her lips, she once more hoped to seek safety in the dark shadows looming over the wall in which she stood.
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 02:41 PM

The paladin pushed the corpse away with his shield, letting it fall to the ground.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 02:55 PM
From up above, Sela watched the last thug fall thanks to Bofwant’s blow with his sword. The light was still so very bright. A warm call for her to come out from where she’d been hiding. She watched Bofwant move over to the guard and she knew exactly what he’d do. He was a healer, a doctor. He’d use whatever was left to heal him... simulation or not. With a soft gasp of worry, Sela put away her bow and climbed down. The room began to shift as she did so. Once her feet were firmly planted on the ground, she raced over to Bofwant, arms extended. The girl immediately began searching him for injury, as she didn’t miss a thing from where she’d been able to watch everything the whole entire time. Sela’s hands were swift, as she checked Bofwant, the worry etched on her fine elven features. “Are... are you all right?” she asked him. “They hit you so hard... so hard...” She could feel her eyes beginning to sting, but she managed to keep her composure. “Are you hurting? Do you need a medic?” she asked, buzzing with questions, her worry only to be quelled if he was able to reassure her of his condition.
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 03:14 PM

Just a little bruising on my ribs and shoulder, it's been a while since I stopped so many bolts and hits with my shield..." He told her softly after sheathing his sword which had stopped glowing. He was trying to ease her fears but the truth was that it had been a while since he had a brawl like that. "I have become rusty..."
"That's why I keep telling you to get out of that nurse house and come to have a few rounds with me every day boy!!" Screamed the warforged from his desk while still doing some paperwork.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 03:27 PM

She frowned a little, her hands careful so as not to hurt him further. “Well, we need to get you patched up then,” she said softly, nodding. As she was about to say more, her words were cut off by the battle master. She purses her lips into a fine line when he seemed to speak down to Bofwant. From her own point of view, he’d been amazing. He’d allowed himself to take the worst of it. Protecting her from their angry blows and no doubt their angry intentions. He’d done it for everyone but himself. “And rusty or not, that was amazing,” she said. She eyed the warforged for a moment before returning her attention back to Bofwant. “I’d never have been able to survive that. I’m just speechless. I wish I’d been able to do more...”
Mors | Garg | Bof 11-Dec-19 03:55 PM

Without further hesitation, the red head went for his shield and picked it up. Thanks to him, she suffered no damage at all, though she was a bit sore from her climb and being so tense for so long. ShwiggityShwah 23-Dec-19 09:18 AM
@Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE Rose and Edgar were with Parcival in the training hall. The description given so far seemed to give the half elf spymaster pause, enough that he requested they come with him to the training hall. He was there with the trainer Iron Tower going over the illusionary capabilities of the room. "Alright Miss Rose, please go over what you remember. Any kind of odd insignia, uniform?"
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 23-Dec-19 09:26 AM
Rose tilted her head, her wild, white curls falling in her face and briefly hiding those icy eyes. The eladrin never liked thinking back to that dark and terrible moment, but right now... it was a must. She looked to Edgar for comfort, as flashes of Horace’s dismembered body, his screams, filled her head. Her hand went for his, fingers entwining until they were palm against palm. “I wish I’d seen more,” Rose went on. “But, I distinctly recall this strange crest I’d not seen anyone in the area wearing before.” Her face contorted a bit when she saw the one poacher’s face. His eyes, that mouth. “It looked like a bird. A falcon if you wanted me to get specific on what type.” She just shook her head, body trembling. Her free hand clutched at the cool, silky material of her dress, tugging the fabric awkwardly about her lithe body. “Same crest was on the trap that nearly killed me. It was small. But there.” She looked up at Edgar and then to Parcival, hoping these dark memories helped in some way at least.
ShwiggityShwah 23-Dec-19 02:13 PM
Edgar was holding her hand while she spoke and it was not clear if the spymaster noticed, nor cared but merely hung onto her very words. “A falcon?”  Parcival said and the way he said it was not one of confusion but of a rather uncharacteristic concern of the matter.  He listened further as she described what she could. Indeed, not much, but enough. The spy master looked to the warforged.  Iron Tower. He stood up straight and balled his fist.  “Warmaster, if you can peer...” “Aye, I get you Percy.”  The warforged went to a wall and began to move and push pieces as the room seemed to ripple and fluctuate as before their eyes a new figure suddenly appeared from the either.  https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/946213493243265909/25AA76EA8F430031FE0642900697E89FF9AE8DDB/ The woman, with sword, bow, and bird of prey appeared, as if stuck in time.  Unmoving, unfeeling, the crest on a clasp holding her cloak.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 23-Dec-19 04:22 PM
Rose felt herself recoil a bit, not understanding exactly how this training room worked. Parcival and the one called Irin Tower had their discussion when suddenly she saw a woman standing before her. The face wasn’t one she recognized. The girl had had very little contact with others, her experience just limited as a result of her upbringing. Her icy eyes fixed on the bird perched upon her shoulder. “Oh!” Rose yelped, moving backwards, trying to get away. “The crest looked like that!” She continued to try and move, her abrupt and awkward movements causing the eladrin to trip and fall right there. “Oww!” she cried out, hitting the floor with a thud. Eyes fixed on the woman, she tried to scramble away. Suddenly, Rose realized the woman and her pet weren’t moving. She stopped and tried to catch her breath, her face going scarlet with humiliation and embarrassment. “All those men,” she tried again. “Wore some sort of brooch. I did look like that. Almost exactly.” She looked up at Parcival and then Edgar. “What does it mean?” she asked them all.
ShwiggityShwah 23-Dec-19 11:23 PM
"Rose you okay!?" Edgar tried to catch her, but failed, and whiskers just jumped in surprise. Edgar offered a hand arm and shoulder to get up with with. Parcival and Iron Tower seemed less worried. Iron Tower actually seemed to roll his eyes. Parcival went up next to the hologram and waved his hand towards it. "Lady Rose. This is a member of a band known as The Flock. They are man catchers. Monster trappers. Bounty Hunters. Assassins. One of the only organizations that are still in operation, even after the penalty. If you've been Marked by the Flock, then I am afraid to tell you, that your fears are quite validated. The Flock follows a code of ending their target or die trying." "My gods..." Edgar whispered under his breath. "What I would like to know, is how in the Hells did you get targetted by them?" Parcival said, accusing them. (edited)
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 24-Dec-19 08:51 AM
Rose reached out for Edgar, sliding her hand into the one he offered her. Once up, her eyes wide with worry and fear, she looked to the ranger who’d captured her heart and shook her head. Never had she expected the poachers to be... this. She’d remembered how Horace had been the day he’d found her in that one trap. For an old curmudgeon, the man had been beside himself. He’d muttered strange things that, at the time, hadn’t made any sense. Things about catchers—a term she’d been unfamiliar with—and prizes, exotics in the snowy mountains. But she’d lost a lot of blood during that ordeal and had always decided her state at the time had played a role. “My mentor, Horace, had them on his list after I fell into one of their traps. He’d been expecting me and when I hadn’t shown up, he went searching.” Rose paused, her face going even paler than it already was. “Hours had passed. I honestly thought I’d die. But Horace found me,” she went on, her hands wringing with agitation, as she stood there explaining. “He freed me from the trap. I knew there was something strange about it, though Horace and I never discussed it. He seemed rather shaken by it and I know he was worried about my condition. He nursed me back to health and then told me not to return for several days. He said we’d need a new schedule. I... I didn’t question him.” (edited)
Rose looked over at Edgar, trying to read him. She worried that her baggage was getting him in over his head. No doubt he hadn’t signed up for this when they’d met. If it was too much... she’d understand. She looked down at her satchel then. Lily. Was she honestly the best one to be her mother? Someone marked and hunted by such a notorious group. And for why? Because she was an eladrin in a world of humans. “Things went on normally for a while, though we did start that new schedule he’d planned. Horace seemed to be more at ease because of it. Then...” The eladrin closed her eyes. The memory so very clear. “Then, one day I arrived and I heard shouting. I could hear Horace arguing with several voices—men—I didn’t recognize. Per our plan, if anything seemed wrong, I was to hide and wait. When all was clear, then I was to run. Horace told them to leave the area, that there was nothing there for them. They refused and said they’d search the place. That... that’s when I heard the Druidic. Horace wanted me to run. To find a way out at all costs.” The girl shook her head, tears falling. “But his screams. They were unnatural. My fear only grew worse, as panic and worry took hold. That was when I saw what they did to him. Oh god...” She nearly collapsed, her tiny body leaning against Edgar for comfort. “They cut him. Disemboweled. Dismembered. He was alive while they did this. Alive...” Unable to help it, Rose started crying. Her heart was aching and suddenly she couldn’t breathe. “I shouted out. I couldn’t help it. I defied Horace because of what he was suffering. But then... I... I saw them. Those eyes, that mouth. The hunger. They saw me. They saw. I had the mountains on my side and I tried to gain sanctuary at home, but...” Her voice trailed, almost a whisper. “My family didn’t want me. I had nothing and no one. So I found passage on a ship and then ended up here.” (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 27-Dec-19 12:18 PM
Edgar was at a loss, the only thing he could do was offer Rose a chest and shoulder to cry on, his arms wrapping around her to offer what little support her could.  She felt his hand gently stroke her hair, try to wipe her eyes on his collar, “I’m sorry.” He whispered, knowing this plan was essentially his fault, and she was suffering cause of him.  Lily detected the dismay, and also seemed to share in her tears, trying to scoot out of the bag and give Rose a little nuzzle into her stomach, barely felt. Parcival sneered a little at the conclusion of her tail as if he was disgusted by the story and at her, but it quickly became apparent that it was towards another.  “Murderous Sadists.” He seemed to growl. “I’m not surprised. Their brutality is exactly why you were left alone. They hunt and steal and drive families apart, but its debatable that a worse fate lies in store for those who would keep them from their quarry.  This has all the makings of the Flock. They use fear to make sure that their targets have no ground to hide in, no person that would risk their blades.” Iron Tower scoffs.  “You’re not telling me you’re afraid of a bunch of yellow bellied thugs who hack apart weak old men.” Parcival glared at his warforged shipmate.  “Forgive my choice of words, but they made the biggest fucking mistake of their lives targeting Rose.  The Flock has been wanted by Erie for decades, their bounties are small tidy fortunes, even for their neophytes.  Since they are targeting her, and thus us, that gives the Steel Hearts no qualms about ignoring them now. I’ll make sure the job goes on the board.” He then looked to Edgar.  “Mr. Edgar, Ms. Rose. I’m putting you two in charge of this endeavor.  Find us some hunters to hunt the Flock among the crew.” Parcival looked to the warforged.  “I’ll offer you some information about their tactics from on hand reports. You think you can make a capable simulation to train?” Iron Tower seemed to spit.  “Does an Orc’s ass smell?”
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 30-Dec-19 05:20 AM
(Fade to Black—scene continues on #the-top-deck)

And so Rose received a pie from a girl named Liz.  “Neat.” Said Edgar. To be honest, after the glow of their time together Edgar was surprised.  He didn’t feel any differently save a wellness within himself and the world. He felt, content. Just like Lily will be just like-“  He put his fingers to his lips and made a sharp whistle, and here comes Whiskers bobbing round the corner.  The weasel bobbing and jumping at him as he lowered a hand. “You excited boy?” The weasel padded his feet and followed.   “Nice of her.  You’d have to introduce me.”  He seemed to sigh, his hands joined with hers.  “The days I wasted down there in the bowels of the ship, and you’re all off having adventures...  Guess I’ll need to find help with the Pens while we’re off on our voyages.” He concluded with her. They entered the training hall, and suddenly he felt the weight of the long bow and his short sword and dagger at his hip.  This was it, combat, and with a squeeze of Rose’s hand it was evident that not only did he need to fight, he needed to impress.  Impress her, and Garg, the captain. How was this going to work?  Was he going to strike out on his own, take Rose with him.  What about his family? What about his animals? He suddenly felt a pit in his stomach.  He didn’t know. He rushed into this without even realizing it. All for a pretty face... no, Rose was more then that.  Much more. He puffed out his chest. He took his hand from hers.  He had to put up a strong capable front and holding her hand would be slightly detrimental.  He had to be strong and strong alone... and with a giant weasel. Dammit this was going to be hard.  “Captain.” He said, holding his head high. The man who saved her and the one Rose felt loyalty too... He was grateful to him.  It was him that allowed them to meet.

He said and a half smile appeared on his face, "Are you aware what are we going to be doing?... What our goal is?... Who I am?" He made his tail thump against the floor between each sentence, instead of meat hitting metal, it sounded like big waves crashing against a sailing hip, like they were in the middle of a storm (Minor illusion).

He could heel his senses heightened, the aggression inside him waiting to be unleashed, just like a frenzy... But the difference was in his mind, now he had control and that implies being fully aware of every little thing. It could be useful if he ever got used to this... Mors | Garg | Bof 22-Jan-20 09:52 AM

The shark captain grolwed to himself and stepped out of the pool, leaving his crew there and started to walk out of the training hall. He was hungry now, just like after each frenzy, so he decided to go and get some food in the mess hall.
ShwiggityShwah 22-Jan-20 12:55 PM
And there he went, leaving without a word.  Still Edgar was expecting more of a tongue lashing.  And yet- “Hmm... Uhhh...” He began, Whiskers getting patched up in the water and crawling out and jumping at his master in a soggy wet hug.  “Sooo am I in?” He looked to Garg who left the room and then to Rose who was looking better. Whiskers dried himself on Edgar before he scrinched himself up and leapt from him to scamper away.   He had some more things on his mind but maybe there was an explanation.  “Sooo... pirates? Or something.” He gave Rose a raised eyebrow. “No offense Starlight, but he seems a little- not aligned with your personality.  Namely you’re a sweet heart, why are you part of his crew?”
Ippo 23-Jan-20 07:53 PM
Pixie fumes some more when it's clear that Garg was ignoring. She even stamps around in the water, and throws her little fists about when he just up and leaves. She turns to Edgar and Rose, again pointing an accusatory finger at them: "Y'all are too gross and mushy for me. I'm outta here to teach Sashimi Nuts a lesson." And just before she disappears around the corner after Garg, she pokes her head back in. "B-but you're not gross, Rosie. And let me know how you like the--n-nevermind!" And she's gone.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 24-Jan-20 10:13 PM
Garg left, followed by Whiskers, and it wasn’t long before Pixie also followed suit as well. Rose then blushed a bit when the halfling excluded her from the group she’d considered abhorrent. Once alone, the eladrin sighed softly and turned towards Edgar. “I know I’m not typical pirate material, but... well... I feel like I owe him my life. Well, I do actually. Before he even knew me he’d pulled me out of the deep water. I’d have drowned. As it was I was suffering hypothermia. So he not only saved me from drowning, he got me somewhere dry and warm.” Rose supposed not everyone would understand, but then how many had actually felt death try and take them? That moment on Icebreaker hadn’t been the first time the eladrin had nearly died. There was also that time in the mountains when she’d fallen victim to the poachers’ trap. She’d owed Horace her life afterwards and had done everything she could to repay him. So she’d do the same for Garg. “Besides. Maybe if he’s surrounded by good people. Maybe just maybe, we can make a difference. And... well... something seems wrong. He’s not the same sharkin I met and know. Something happened. And we should find out what. Maybe we can help.” She paused then. “I don’t know. Maybe I’m too idealistic and naive. I know so little about the world, just... I don’t know. Something inside tells me we should help him. I probably sound silly. Don’t I...”
ShwiggityShwah 29-Jan-20 10:03 PM
Edgar had to shrug. "I thought saving eachother's lives was like... the norm for heroes." He always figured you just did that- no strings attached. Just cause you saved a life didn't mean you owed it to them. He was getting used to the idea of them having a life together, he was hoping it would be theres before anyone else's. "Just make sure you don't suffer for a debt and obligation. You know I'd protect you without asking for anything in return." She gave a couple of suggestions and he nodded. "Pretty silly yes.' He giggled and chuckled. "But I understand. You might consider him your friend, and if you're worried, well you're just trying to help your friend. So long as he doesnt try to... well eat my head or anything, I'm happy to help. He's the captain right?" Be a good little crew and help the captain out.
Question was. "How? Maybe something happened?"

Avrae BOT 03-Apr-20 02:55 PM
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 04:32 PM
As usual, the prizefighter was spending his free time training, working over a heavy bag with various combinations of strikes in preparation for any future fights. The creatures on that damned island had taken far too many hits to go down, and he needed to fix that. So great was his determination, he didn't immediately notice when he was joined in the hall by another goliath, the Guild's new join.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 04:49 PM
With his meeting with the Guild Master finished, he was allowed to roam the ship. Mostly he was curious about this 'Jonny Alpha'; it was an odd name to hear from regarding one of his own kind. It seemed strange for him to use this name, but so long as it didn't diminish his skill then it shouldn't matter. The ship indeed seemed to guide him, like it knew what he was seeking. The sounds of striking reached his ears, his heavy footsteps coming into the room, seeing the gigantic man pummeling a filled bag. He could feel the essence of the mountains in this one, strength of stone coursed through him even with the size difference between them. "It seems the mountains are not for all Goliaths." he would say, his sonorous voice carrying across the room. "I am Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi. Are you the one they call "Jonny Alpha?" he then asked respectfully.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 04:58 PM
Jonny turns from his training to gaze back at the other goliath, taking a few moments to gaze over him. After some moments, he inclines his head, responding in the positive to the question. "The one and only. Don't think I know you... What, another mountain-born here to chastise me about 'abandoning the old ways', or somethin' like that?"
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 05:09 PM
"Any mountain-born that chastises those who seek to improve their own prowess is no true Goliath." Uthal would say, crossing his arms. "Though I hardly think a bag would give you appropriate difficulty." It seemed more likely these two would fight; they were both warriors, after all. Placing his greatsword against a wall, he would then say as he stepped more in range of the other Goliath, "What would you say to a more appropriate challenge?"
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 05:18 PM
Jonny grins, walking slowly over to Uthal and looking him in the eyes. "I'd ask the name of the guy doin' the challenging, for one." The prizefighter rolls his shoulders, definitely not one to turn down a fight when offered, and having taken a liking to this, seemingly more mindful individual among those of his own race that he'd met thus far.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 05:31 PM
Cracking his neck, Uthal then said, "I gave my name already, but you may simply call me Lonehunter." Squaring off against the slightly smaller Goliath he would then say as he put his own hands up. "Let us begin" he would say, those black eyes locking on his opponent.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 05:56 PM
"S'pose I must not've been paying attention." He shrugs, and takes up a stance of his own, easily falling into a rhythm as he bounced lightly on his toes. "Sure you don't wanna use that sword? Promise ya, these fists hit just as hard as any hunk o' steel."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 06:00 PM
"If I am to fight against you, it will be with the same tools you use." he would say; pride in even combat was a facet of Goliath culture. There was no honor any other way. "If they hit truly as hard as you say, then it will be a good fight."
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 07:05 PM
"If ya say so. Any particular ruleset you had in mind?" Because fighting without rules was best saved for opponents who didn't deserve such consideration. This person had proved a decent sort, thus far.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 07:14 PM
Rules. This "Jonny Alpha" was a Goliath, any mountain-born could see it. "We fight with all of our strength, but this pad we are on will encompass our arena." he would say; he then went back and retrieved his greatsword, slamming it down hard across the mat, creating a low wall that was in front of the punching bag. "My sword will act as another barrier, neither of us can cross over it or the edges of the mat. Any who steps beyond this will automatically lose." It would be a small area to fight, but he'd used his sword plenty; he would now see if his melee ability measured up to his prowess with the blade. "Aside from that, any and all maneuvers are allowed."
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 07:41 PM
"Very well, that's agreeable. We'll begin when you're ready..." He cedes the initiative to the other Goliath, smirking lightly as he puts up his guard.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 08:00 PM
Taking his stance, Uthal went immediately for a right jab, missing his opponent as he might duck out of the way. "Good reflexes" he would say; it was likely this start up would be slow, but then it was two Goliaths fighting each other. Who knew what would happen?
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 08:07 PM
The assumption that this would be a slow fight is immediately dissolved as Jonny's fist slams into the side of Uthal's jaw like an iron mace. Another strike follows, but goes wide. "Still think leavin' that sword to the ground was a good idea?" The prizefighter grins cockily, feeling that he easily held the advantage.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 08:11 PM
Uthal definitely got stunned by the hard strike; seemed this one was indeed a skilled fighter. "A true Goliath challenges himself in all respects; advantages can easily be lost. We all must make sure we can utilize every bit of ourselves." he would say, his words a bit slurred. And it seemed like he was certain dizzy, his next strike wide as he went to a knee.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 08:20 PM
Another strike follows, landing clean from the opportunity given. "A fighter needs to learn the difference between challenge and overexertion, otherwise they run themselves ragged." Then another, though rather than following through, it stops cold upon Uthal's skin. Ah, the blessing of the Goliath race, Stone's Endurance.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 08:28 PM
The second strike hit him hard, knocking Uthal to an elbow while kneeling. Thankfully, the third found no purchase; his skin hardened to Jonny's strike, negating the damage as he rose back. "Overexertion does not exist to a Goliath. There is only pride in giving one's all to the challenge". Uthal replied; his vision still hazy, he then went for a second punch, but missed horribly.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 08:34 PM
Jonny meets that assertion with a punch- which sends his eyes wide, noting how the other Goliath seems to have barely felt it. One follow-up goes completely wide in a momentary panic, but a rushed third strike lands clean.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 08:37 PM
The continued strikes hammered down, but now Uthal was focused, pushing past the bruises and cuts that formed on his skin from their fight. If he did fall, he would take lessons from this, maybe even see if Jonny Alpha himself could help refine his fist-fighting capabilities. Regardless, he subconsciously called upon his totem spirit for strength to give it through; this one had earned that much. And he was rewarded when a blow struck Johnny hard in the chest.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 08:41 PM
The strike catches him sufficiently off-guard that another planned strike goes completely off target. The prizefighter has to center himself a moment before going through with another attempted One-Two, ultimately only getting half of what he'd tried for in the end. "Not bad... Strong as I'd expected from any Goliath. But..."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 08:46 PM
"As are you..." Uthal replied, his footing definitely unsteady after the next barrage; even with only half, this Jonny Alpha was a Goliath at heart. Their blows shook the room, so immense was a Goliath's strength. And soon, Jonny too would feel that he was no slouch himself, even if he had less training in the hand-to-hand aspect of martial arts; a fist landed hard on Jonny's jawline, his full power finally a more acceptable answer to the thrashing he was being given, even if it now left him more open to a counter, his arms weakly raised to try and shield himself from further blows.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 08:54 PM
Jonny nearly stumbles from the sudden, forceful strike. Instead, though, he steels himself, eyes alight with the wrath of an insulted artist. "Not... Bad... But..!" One strike. The Barbarian is dazed, reeling. The prizefighter snarls; "You've got no style!" A second strike follows, and Uthal is floored. Ten seconds pass as the Pugilist awaits any attempt at getting up, and then lets out a breath of relief as the knockout is confirmed, at least by official standards.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 08:58 PM
Uthal hit the floor, the sword that made the fourth wall of their little ring jumping up a bit from the force of his fall and falling to his side. His vision swam as the final blow dazed him, the slate-colored flesh adorned with fresh bruises and cuts. It wasn't much longer before Uthal stirred, giving a grunt as he stared at the ceiling. "You have a warrior's strength; if you hadn't known it before, know at least now that no mountain-born can look down on you." Uthal said, holding out a hand, more as a test of his honor than anything else.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 09:03 PM
The prizefighter gives a grim laugh, but takes ands shakes the barbarian's hand nonetheless. "Trust me, I already knew... But thanks. I get the feeling it'd have been a much uglier fight if you had gone through with that offer to use that giant hunk o' metal ya call a sword." After shuffling back from the handshake, Jonny gives another huff. "But damn, ya punch like a fuckin' carthorse for someone with no trainin' with 'is fists. Ya sure ya didn't miss a callin' by not taking to the arenas like yours truly? Crowds 'd be all over ya, I can tell ya that much."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 09:10 PM
"Perhaps, perhaps not." Uthal replied after Jonny helped him up and shook his hand; indeed, this man could help him learn a great deal. Taking his sword up, he then reslung it across his back as Jonny asked his question. He talked so strangely; maybe it was just the Common tongue? His own Common was still rusty, far more fluent in Orc and Giant than itself. "My fights have come from the wild; I have pitted myself against various forms of beast. Boars, giant serpents, and smaller wyverns; I wish to someday be able to challenge the likes of dragons and wyrms." he would reply.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 09:15 PM
"Hah, ambitious! I can respect that. Tell ya what, mountain-born, ya ever need any custom metalwork done, be it for weapons or armor, ya come find me. I don't do any o' that fancy magical stuff, but anythin' that any Smith of quality can make, so can I- at cost, since you're one of the few among our kind I've met that ain't been a pain over the fact that I was city-born and raised."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Apr-20 11:30 PM
Uthal nodded at his offer, "Should the need arise, I will come seek you out. City-born or not, a Goliath is a brother so long as he can stand on his own two feet and take pride in his achievements. And perhaps one day soon, I can challenge you again when I am ready." There was a reason Goliaths never lived as long as they did; they were unbelievably stubborn about challenging things. Fate shaped the stones, and time allowed them to grow into the mountains they called home. Those that couldn't stand up to time fell away, as they did when no challenges existed to face them. And with one last curt nod, Uthal took his leave. Now to seek his quarters the Captain had promised him before going to the rest of the ship.
!exit Uthal
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 22-Apr-20 11:33 PM
Jonny chuckled, and headed off to wander about the ship, figuring that he'd gotten enough training in for one day.

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 02-May-20 11:50 PM
Uthal had followed them in, seeing all the newcomers here. It was quite a turnout; he hadn't expected so many. But then, this was a rather well-known vessel and crew; surely that was the reason they had so many members? He did find it amusing how he and Mors stood heads above the others due to their size, but the other Goliath was far more imposing with his armor and glowing eyes. Uthal had no money or means to get armor; it was something he would like at some point, but he would work to earn it. And besides, if he hadn't needed it thus far, he must be doing something right. He chuckled at the other who introduced herself to Mors; it seemed this one commanded respect. He must have a great tenure aboard this vessel, his black eyes scanning the crowd as he sought out the 'metal man' that was mentioned. He was supposedly the one in charge of organizing this challenge. "So many....Thank goodness this room is spacious." Uthal commented, then turning his next question to Mors and Irithriel as he came to stand beside them, "Who is this 'metal man'? Is it the one named Cassius?" Of course, he had no clue at all; it was the only other metal...thing...that could speak that came to mind. His eyes then regarded the woman who had named herself as Lady Delielah, but said nothing himself.

Mors

Mors | Garg | Bof 03-May-20 09:18 AM
Iron Tower
Clang Clang Clang metallic sounds could be heard from the small office attached to the training hall, then the small door slowly opened, revealing the big shape of Iron Tower. The warforged stepped out of the small room and walked to the middle of the training hall. His arms crossed over his plated chest and his expression stern. "I told Clay that I wanted more promising warriors and when that wannabe overlord came here asking for a challenge I started to get some hopes... But what do I get? A bunch of ladies. Two of them pregnant..." He said in his ussual callous way while looking at Irithriel and Vivian. "... Two of them naked..." He continued, his eyes still on Vivian but then moving to Uthal. "...And two of them bringing their handmaidens with them..." This time his eyes found Delielah and ended up on Mors. "If your girls are trying to be sneaky, they are failing miserably." And with a clap of his metallic hands the couple of invisible green minions just behind Iri were revealed. "Let's get this show done, I just can't deal with this..." The battle master said while shaking his head and walking back to his office. His voice sounded dissapointed like they had failed the challenge already. As he walked out of sight, the room started to transform right in front of everyone's eyes. The walls dissapeared and the blowing wind could be felt by everyone. The party found themselves in the middle of a village, a big fortress could be seen on a Hill just behind the group of wooden buildings. The sun was coming down... And everyone was rushing around like crazy. "They are coming!!" "There's no time!!" "Where's my son!!" "Close the bloody windows!!" It was chaos, it was madness and they were right in the middle of it.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 03-May-20 09:32 AM
