Instead, she turned back towards Mors and gave him a nuzzle. “Yes, well, as eccentric as Copper was, I do believe she had some good to offer. ‘Twas a shame though.” She paused a moment. “Though perhaps her little pilgrimage will help her reconcile with her patron.” At that, she shrugged and went into her tiptoes, place a kiss against his chest. The girl giggled then, readying her bow like she knew her beast would want her to. She hoped to make him proud despite her current condition. Suddenly, Iri heard that all too familiar voice. It was then that the warforged revealed himself, though he seemed to feel no need for introductions. Instead, per typical, he threw out his insults and then all of them into whatever challenged he’d concocted. “Ohh... it’s changing up, my beast,” she said softly, her voice pleasant and melodic. “My bow is ready and so is my magic.” Mors would hear the child-like excitement in her voice, as she began to prepare in her way. Suddenly, she found herself amidst people. Running. Confused. And obviously terrified. Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 03-May-20 06:11 PM

He would ask him...But then the giant left, muttering about wanting to get this done. As the exercise started, Uthal got on the defensive, readying his titanic greatsword; the surface of it wasn't anything remarkable, more like someone had roughly shaped a hunk of scrap into a double-edged blade and then tackily stuck a handle/pommel on it. Even so, this blade had given him many victories, and helped him learn the ways of swordfighting. Plus its size fit him, allowing him to feel like he was naturally holding a weapon that he could use. "Let us try to find the source of the panic, and deal with it." he would then say to Mors in Giant, his black eyes looking around as he tried to discern any sounds of fighting, or look for clues to who would be stirring the people into such a frenzy. Other braver ones were still trying to reinforce their own houses with wood awere just getting into houses with barricaded windows. One big thing they would notice was that the sun was coming down unnaturally fast and little by little a giant moon was revealed hovering behind the forest.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 05-May-20 07:52 AM

Mors | Garg | Bof 05-May-20 11:44 AM
Mors
Mors looked curious at the beast that the woman with the strange ears just summoned in front of the group, it made him remember those wolves from the frozen mountain. "Interesting..." he muttered. He ignored everyone else, his eyes moving towards the east once again. He couldn't see anything but be could feel the danger in the air. Good he thought, Finally a challenge. He had to give it to the metal man, he sure knew how to make interesting encounters. Then he chuckled at the sight of his mate just moving away on her own, his two green minions following her like he had previously commanded. He didn't care about the villagers and just wanted to stay here and wait for the thing that was coming but he had promised her that they wouldn't be separated again... Even if this whole scene was a fake one, so with another amused chuckle he followed her towards the big building.
Scene
Just then some really loud screams reached the group ears. It was very easy to tell that they were coming from the edge of the forest and that they were from dying villagers. Just then the sun finally dissapeared, it's orange rays weren't protecting the village anymore from the danger and only the glow of the eerie moon remained. One, two, three seconds passed... before a rain of arrows fell upon the small town.
Aki! 05-May-20 11:55 AM
"Ah!"
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 05-May-20 12:09 PM
Uthal only stood at the ready alongside Mors and the others; he wasn't sure what was coming. There was a threat looming on the horizon, surely that giant fortress in the background was the source. He would hear the other woman's words, only saying "There will always be battle; we can minimize the casualties by cutting out the heart of the beast, and then lopping off its head for good measure." Before the group would act further, Mors and Irtihriel moving in the direction of the building, the other goliath followed. However, Uthal's primal senses tingled; he happened to look up to see the silhouettes in the glow of the moon's light. "Get down!" he bellowed, trying to warn the others; he could take the hit, given his nature, but there were others that could not. He swung his own greatsword in front of him, the wide blade deflecting many of the arrows...All of them in fact, the sounds of metal on metal pinging off as the arrows fell to his side. Not one even managed to nick his fingers.
Mors | Garg | Bof 05-May-20 12:30 PM
Mors

The two green minions also jumped in front the the elf. The three flying minions took most of the projectiles that would have reached Iri and lucky for them they didn't pass out from the pain like one would have expected from such small creatures. "Good." Mors groaned to himself after seeing that his mate hadn't been hit by the attack and then turned to see what exactly had attacked them. (edited)
Scene
Far in the distance, just emerging from the forest, was a big horde of moving skeletons. Most of them were armed.woth swords, bows or blunt weapons and most of them had some armor. There was even some mounted ones ridding skeleton horses. And each one of them were striking down every living creature they could reach.
Aki! 05-May-20 12:35 PM

Delielah/Abby 05-May-20 12:44 PM

Mors | Garg | Bof 05-May-20 12:53 PM
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 06-May-20 01:05 PM
Uthal saw the horde emerging from the forest; a smile crossed his face. So many! He'd hardly ever fought undead before, especially in such numbers. "Let us see, Mors, who can turn the most into shards!" he would say to his Goliath brother, readying his greatsword; anyone who happened to look at him would notice a large aura appear around him. A swirl of primal energy, imbuing his already massive and sturdy form with even more power. This was the way of his training, his compact with the Bear of the Mountains. And he would use every ounce he could muster to smite these adversaries. And with a bellow to shatter the air, he charged forward, unerringly towards the skeleton horde. His blade intent on cutting them down.
Mors | Garg | Bof 06-May-20 01:14 PM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 06-May-20 07:31 PM
As the hail of arrows blotted the darkening sky, Irithriel turned to make sure her Mors was in sight. She heaved a sigh of relief, her legs still bringing her closer to the inn. She then glanced around, a means to gain her bearings. The girl didn’t really know the others, but she saw Lonehunter take off towards... oh! Undead! Iri squeaked softly, her mind humming with what to do. Her lips then puckered into a pout and she let out a huff. Turning towards Mors, she spoke softly in Elvish, “Inspired...” The girl then noticed the little green minion who’d protected her. “And you... inspired...” Satisfied that her mate and the sweet little dear who’d sacrificed himself for her had been aided, she continued onwards towards the inn. Mind whirling with questions, Iri wanted to understand just what was happening. And the best way she knew how was to get answers. Answers from those who were running. Once at the door of the inn, she knocked upon it. “Please,” she shouted. “Let me in... I am with child and not from here...” The girl hoped her comments might inspire some sympathy and help ensure they opened the door. While she waited, she then traced a sigil in the air, “Protect...” she muttered, a white light of protection flaring momentarily about her, her mind suddenly flooded with thoughts of protecting her unborn son. (edited)
Psyliced 06-May-20 09:11 PM
Shadja moved to the nearby tree and took cover behind its mighty girth. Peeking out from behind it she sent a mental command to Sylver to charge and attack the approaching horde. She tried to pick out a target where she might be able to prevent another innocent from dying senselessly. "We need to get in there quickly!" She punctuated the statement with the heavy 'twang' of her crossbow's release. Her horse-sized wolf, silver lurched into action, his massive legs pumping quickly as his paws thumped the ground with ferocious intent. With a snarling bark he leapt into the throng and engaged with the closest undead. (edited)

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 06-May-20 10:55 PM
The blasts came down from around him, the sounds of magic arcs being fired not lost on the large Goliath. Several of them blew apart from the strikes, littering the ground with splinters and shards of fragmented bone. Several fell to the ground as well, their bones turned to dust and the armor they were wearing now laying useless. Even with this, though, his focus would be undeterred; the enemy was before him, and they would break against the stone wall that was his form! Even though a few managed to cut him as he would engage, he would not stop; this was the heart of every Goliath, to dive into the fray and be the strong wall of stone that shattered their enemies! "Giant's strength and mountain's power, let the Mother of Stone flow vitality through me!" he then bellowed in Giant, drawing his huge blade back and slamming it forward. Several skeletons shattered beneath the force of his blade, the sounds of metal crushing bone resonating as a howl of primal fury and joy erupted from him. This would be a good fight, indeed! Skeletons once whole were reduced to mere powder, comrades of theirs sent flying backward and through the air like macabre ragdolls. His frenzy continued, cleaving away a sizable portion of the horde as his massive blade went through, carving chunks away from the enormous undead army.

Mors | Garg | Bof 08-May-20 09:16 PM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-May-20 10:28 PM

The girl had to admit it looked scary, scarier than the castles she’d visited back in the Feywild. But please, call me Iri.” She smiled at the Veira and flicked her snowy hair over a shoulder. “I talked to a few people inside the inn and they mentioned that the count lost his love and has been seeking vengeance since.” The pretty elf frowned then. “So the count is the source of the trouble. Perhaps if we find him, we can end this curse once and for all.” Iri has decided that seeking the count was the only way to lift this strange ‘three night’ curse. After all, he would continue sending swarms of monsters upon everyone no matter how many they fought through. Perhaps stopping the source would stop the worst of it. Though a part of her felt sad for the man who had to lose his beloved. She wasn’t sure what she’d do if she lost her Mors. The thought was unthinkable! And it made her heart hurt. “I hope this count is a reasonable man,” Iri thought aloud. Obviously, the pretty elf preferred diplomacy over fighting... if such an option presented itself.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 11-May-20 10:35 PM
Uthal trudged after the group, the last of the horde falling down around them; their bodies littered the road, and for now the town had survived the assault. Sure, some had perished...But that was the ruthless calculus of nature. Fate did not care who one was, fate had no sympathy for those unfit to survive; it was best to live one's life as fully as possible, and go into the afterlife with no regrets. At least that was what Uthal was taught growing up; care for another, and keep your bonds strong to help live your life to the fullest. But do not let your past weigh you down, lest the tides of death wash over you and sweep you away. He caught up in time to hear Irithriel's comment, and a heavy scowl crossed his face. "The death of a loved one is a sad event, but to cause so much anguish to others. It is more than clear his pain has compromised his judgment." Uthal replied, coming to stand beside the group, his wounds still slightly open; though for how much he was in the thick of it, he was relatively unhurt. "If need be, I suggest you all ready yourselves to fight him to the death. If that horde was truly under his power, who knows what other monstrosities he has stowed away." he would then tell them; though in truth, he was excited. If he could summon so many undead, what other beasts lay within these walls? "But let us not dally with idle chatter; if this count is the problem, then it is best we cut out the heart of the beast." (edited)
Mors | Garg | Bof 12-May-20 09:08 PM
Mors walked besides Irithriel, silently listening to her explanation. His big hammer resting on his shoulders while he kept his shield ready to protect his mate from any attack. The wound on his back was only a full throbbing now and it was no bother to him. The minions trailed after her too, ready to follow Mors previous commands and one of the green ones was keeping an eye on the blue, to keep it from doing something stupid again. "Do not worry mate. This man shall fall before our might." He stated, no doubt in his mind that whatever the challenge, they would conquer it. After all, doubt was for fools. After hearing Uthal's words the overlord smiled. "Only a fool would cull his own kingdom year after year. Even the weak ones can be useful. And if revenge is what he wants, then he should take it by himself... Not have his weak minions do it." The whole concept of love was still alien to him but he was certain of one thing... No one would take his mate from him, so in his eyes, this count was a fool. "You fought well hunter. You showed real strength there... Now we will see if you can use that strength to overcome an enemy that is not mindless." Mors was not sure if this count will be a challenge, but any overlord with a fortress and a small kingdom should be smart. "And you, strange woman, where is your pet?" He asked Shadja. He had seen Sylver taking down skeletons and had become interested... Perhaps in the future he would find some beasts like that for himself.
Psyliced 12-May-20 09:16 PM
The Viera bowed her head politely as they strode on. Brushing back a lock of her her deep purple as she looked up at the party once more she introduced herself. "I am called Shadja. Sorry for not introducing myself before we were dropped into that mess. As for Sylver, my wolf, he has returned to his demiplane to rest." She produces her tarot cards from her pouch once more, shuffling it deftly. The backs of the cards artfully depict the image of a large tree crowned with 12 silver stars upon a purple night sky. The borders are gilded and glimmer in the moonlight. Without looking, she draws the top card and reveals it to Mors, the image on the face is that of a grey wolf in a proud pose, his head lifted upward toward the heavens. "Here he is. Over time he will recuperate till he is ready to join me in battle once more. I have but two other such companions at present, and hopefully I'll be able to meet more in my travels."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 12-May-20 11:30 PM
Hearing the compliment from the other Goliath, Uthal gave a slight of the head. "I thank you for your kind words. You were, as the humans say, 'no slouch yourself'. Many fell beneath your hammer and magics." he replied; it was a charming expression that he found rather useful. And though his Common was still rough, he was still learning these new and interesting phrases. "And yes, if this man is so foolish as to kill those who could be beneficial to his kingdom, then it is clear that the leadership must change. Personal tragedies should not interfere with the ability to perform in one's station. A truly effective ruler would have taken that pain and bettered himself through it." Cold? Maybe, but every Goliath he'd met held the same mindset. Those who could not perform their duties should be replaced by any means, and conflict should strengthen. Only the weak stones crumbled after being worn by the endless cruelty of fate and time; the strong stones stood tall and proud. The mountains that gave Goliaths their home would not exist if this were not true. "Now...Let us see what this 'Count' holds within his fortress, and crush it as the boulders would crush the fool." (edited)
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 13-May-20 07:59 AM
Irithriel smiled up at Mors, just always to be happy in his company. It was also warming her heart to see him becoming friends with others, especially the newest goliath. She knew he needed others just like anyone else and, so far, the two he’d met seemed quite nice. The girl was certain his mind was already spinning. Humming a little, Iri then skipped ahead just a bit. The castle was getting close and she could see another from the earlier group not too far off. She also caught sight of something else by what appeared to be the main door. “What are those?” she asked the others, pointing to more undead. She was a sheltered creature of the Feywild. The various undead just were not something she’d seen before. “Do you suppose there’s another way in? Perhaps we should search the walls for a different entrance?” Despite her questions, the girl would bet both her Mors and Uthal would want to face those odd creatures head on. It was their pattern, their way. But still, she was curious and inquisitive, familiar enough with how castles could sometimes be. So, it didn’t hurt to bring it up.
Mors | Garg | Bof 13-May-20 10:53 PM
"Interesting..." Was the only thing he said to Shadja. He had found recently that he could summon his minions from his kingdom when he wanted but he had not tried to make them return like this woman did with her companion. "Those... Are more targets to defeat." Answered Mors after the ground came near the entrance of the castle. His echoing voice sounding as gruff as ever but for those familiar to him would detect the excitement. He also glanced at Uthal, to see if the other giant was getting ready for the second fight. "There is no need for another entrance little moon. We shall bring down these creatures before destroying that thing that is blocking our way to that fool." He said as he raised his Warhammer and pointed towards the giant wooden door that the zombies were trying to open. But before actually doing anything, the overlord looked at his mate and softly asked her, "That is unless you wish to go in search for this other opening?" After all he had his fun with the skeletons and he wanted his little elf to enjoy this too.
Delielah/Abby 14-May-20 08:31 AM
The yellow hoodling would woddling behind the group catching up to them with some amount of haste. It would be babbling to the other minions asking about things that only concern the minions and there true objective if any. Delielah would spot the party, she would go up to them and say in response to More, "I've tried finding a different way, this lord is a complete looney, if we want in, it will have to be by force..."
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 14-May-20 10:09 AM
He'd heard the winged woman's words, giving a small laugh, "At least he is competent enough to try and funnel us in through one way. Wouldn't be any fun if there wasn't some sort of obstacle for us to crush." And in truth, this just confirmed more in Uthal's mind what he already believed: That this lord was still sane, and chose to butcher his own people. He was a man unfit to rule now that his own history had consumed him. Even still, Uthal did realize others would want to use a more subtle approach; honestly? There was no wrong way to get a job done, so long as it was done by the most qualified people. And that just happened to be them at the moment, it seemed. "If she wishes to find another way in, I will gladly provide a distraction." Uthal would say in response to hearing the other giant's words towards his mate; he cricked his neck and loosened his shoulders, bringing up his massive blade.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 14-May-20 11:27 AM
Irithriel glanced about the area noting that there was a nearby river flowing from the woods, along with... the silence. No life seemed to surround the area, just a sense of unlife and... her gray eyes moved to the zombies at the door... undead. She frowned then, moving close to Mors for a moment. The girl leaned against him, resting her head against his chest. “Those bony beasts hurt you, my beloved,” she whispered, her delicate hands slowly caressing him. “Heal, my beast...” she whispered, a warm soft glow moving from her touch and into her mate’s body. She smiled then, knowing she’d gone a little overboard right then and there with her bit of magic. But she didn’t care. It was for the love of her life. The father of their unborn son. She looked up at Mors then, moving onto her tiptoes so that she could kiss the upper part of his chest. “Go have fun with Lonehunter,” Iri said softly, sweetly. “While you both tend to the door, I can look for other ways in... or out.” She giggled a little, her gaze moving to her mate’s newest friend and battle ally. “Call to me if you need aid, while I search around. I’ll see what I can find and try my best.” As Iri curtsied for both goliaths, she then turned on her heels and moved closer to the castle to see what she might possibly find. While skipping off, she waved her hands sharing some extra elf magic for them both... should things get rough at any point for either. “Good luck!” she said sweetly, turning one last time to blow a kiss to Mors and then happily nod her snowy head at Lonehunter. The girl knew the pair could vanquish those creatures. They were born for such things.
Mors | Garg | Bof 15-May-20 02:20 AM

Irithriel approached the castle wall, satisfied that both Mors and Lonehunter were protected enough. At least for the moment. Once she’d come upon the walls, her eyes scanned the structure, her other senses reaching out—it still unnerved her how nothing alive seemed to be near the place. She could still hear the babbling waters of the nearby river, but it was too far for her to be overly concerned. So, she kept her focus on the castle itself, though she made sure she didn’t meander too far from her mate. No doubt if he’d lost sight of her, that wouldn’t bode well for anyone. For several moments, Iri inspected the walls, but all she could see were metal bars barring any hope of entering the castle by another means. The girl pouted then and just turned to watch what the others were doing. She tapped her lip with a finger and slowly headed back closer to the main door. If the scuffle didn’t get too out of hand, she had some ideas on how she might assist those more inclined to jump into the fray.

She watched with delight, as two of the creatures were suddenly ablaze, washed in the glimmering lavender light she’d produced. “Yes!” she squealed happily, knowing this would give her friends and her mate an advantage.

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 20-May-20 02:35 PM
It seemed this battle, and everyone's help, was wearing down the enemy forces. Irithriel's magic shook this relentless foe, Shadja and her companion aided against his normally-effective blows, and their combined efforts. And with a mighty bellow, Uthal's greatsword raised up, its rough edge cutting down harshly. The sword the wight wielded shattered beneath his strength, the massive piece of iron cleaving the undead in two and leaving a sizable divot. "Undeath has granted you no favor, beast!" Uthal shouted in Giant, still feeling the wight's power trying to drain him. He was definitely ecstatic now; if this type of adversary awaited them outside, he couldn't wait to see what was inside. Uthal saw there was no others around; it seemed the defense forces had been eradicated. "Now then...Let us celebrate this victory by destroying this count!" Uthal shouted, ripping his sword from the earth and without much other thought, took off towards the castle entrance. (edited)
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 20-May-20 07:08 PM
As the undead began to fall, crumpling into heaps on the ground, Irithriel let out a tiny squeak of delight and immediately rushed to Mors’ side. She began kissing his chest, nuzzling him with great affection and love. “Are you all right, my beast?” she asked him, finally resting her hands against his chest and closing her pretty gray eyes. “Heal, my beloved beast...” she whispered, the warm glow of healing magic once again flowing from her to him. When finished, Iri smiled up at Mors, reaching up to touch him just a bit more. If only time could stop. If only they could be alone... just for a moment. Her body longed for his, but being close by would have to do. They had a mission to complete, after all. At that, she called out to Lonehunter. “Wait! Lonehunter, wait!” Watching the battle unfold, the girl was certain the goliath would bolt if she hadn’t called out his name. “I’ll be back, my beast,” Iri then said softly, sweetly to her Mors. She gave him one last kiss and then sprinted towards Lonehunter. “Let me help you,” she then offered, reaching to touch his bicep. “Heal...” she whispered in elvish. That same warm glow she’d used on Mors was now flowing onto her mate’s new best friend. The girl smiled when she finished and curtsied. “I hope that helps,” she added almost shyly, just elated that despite her condition she was able to help at all.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 20-May-20 07:25 PM
Lonehunter paused in his running, hearing the angelic voice of Mors' mate calling out his name; he turned around to see the expectant mother coming towards him. "What is it? Are there more?" he would then ask her; he was sure they got them all. Did they not? Though his expression turned to one of confusion as she touched his bulging bicep, hearing her say...something...before a warm rush flowed through his massive frame. Her magic seemed to make the green marks along his body glow slightly, the wounds he'd sustained during the fight closing up to leave nary a scratch - only the very minor of wounds - along his flesh. His eyes closed as the warmth washed over him like a waterfall, his shoulders visibly relaxing as the ethereal glow faded. Before long his eyes opened back up, peering down at the Elven matron, giving her a smile. "It has helped. You have my thanks." he would say, turning to face the castle once more and raising his blade. He then shouted in Giant "The mountains will bury you, coward!" before rushing off once more.
Delielah/Abby 20-May-20 10:20 PM
Delielah would hand her rapier to the hoodling in a dismissive manner, she looked at the gate with concern, "This person is a lunatic and too paranoid fory taste, it would better to the big muscly men to break the door with a big thick log..." She would point to the nearby large trees, "Perhaps one of those?" The hoodling would begin to start polishing the rapier it was tasked to clean.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 20-May-20 10:32 PM
Irithriel just giggled when she saw Lonehunter grin, his body recovering before both of their eyes. The girl was glad to have been able to help her mate’s new best friend. But now they all had one big problem ahead of them... opening the door. It seemed locked or sealed in some way. Glancing up, she saw the birds and frowned, deciding that meant climbing was out of the question, not that she should be climbing anything in her current condition anyway. So, Iri skipped back to Mors, leaning her weight against him a bit. She peered up at his face, almost certain the goliath was smiling down at her behind that helmet of his. At that, she blushed, her scent heavy in the air about them. “I think the door is locked or sealed. And there seem to be birds flying above. How will we get the door open? Is it safe?” (edited)
Mors | Garg | Bof 21-May-20 03:22 PM
Mors remained in place, silently watching his mate heal him and the hunter. He also heard Delielah's suggestion and thought it would be a good plan but didn't say anything, his anger too great at the moment. After a minute he finally calmed down, the faint glow coming from under his armor dissapeared, and only the one coming from his eyes remained. "We will do as the woman suggested and break down that door blocking us from reaching that fool." He said loud enough for everyone to hear him. "But first, we will watch the hunter." His voice more soft this time, the words directed at Irithriel and his minions. Just like she thought he was smiling at her under his helmet and would have wrapped his arms around her if he wasn't holding his big weapon and shield. "Mors!" The blue minion acknowledged the plan while the green ones just silently moved closer, ready to act.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 21-May-20 03:44 PM
Uthal by this point had reached the door, sword in hand and his blood still burning with the desire for combat. This count dared used such tactics against them, and stupidly harvested his own people. And now Uthal would end this curse in his mind, one way or another. The people he ruled over should not have to suffer for his lunacy. With these thoughts in mind, Uthal brought up his greatsword and with a loud bellow, swung with everything he could muster. CRACK The hole was massive but he was unsatisfied; he could do better! Raising his sword again, he then let it carry forward CRACK The door's structure faltered, but still held, though he'd carved another chunk out of it; even so, he could make it bigger! CRACK A third swing knocked out a sizable chunk of the barrier, leaving more than enough for room for even he and Mors to fit through. He looked down at his blade, seeing its edge had dulled; giving a shrug, he just thought it would be fine. It would still hurt if swung. "Our path is clear!" he then said, raising his dulled greatsword and calling his comrades to arms.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 21-May-20 05:24 PM
Irithriel had been nodding, as her Mors explained the next logical plan of attack. It was a reasonable idea that she agreed with. Giving him a smile, she suddenly heard a shout, followed by a loud thwack. “Oh... oh my goodness!” she shrieked, not quite sure what she was seeing. The girl peered around Mors, watching the other goliath thrash his large weapon over and over at the solid wooden door. “My beast... what is Lonehunter doing? Perhaps we should check on him...” At that, the pretty elf tugged on her mate’s arm, pulling him towards where Lonehunter and Delielah were.
Mors | Garg | Bof 21-May-20 06:47 PM
Mors watched the whole spectacle while still keeping an eye on the surroundings, ready to take down any undead that tried to attack him or his mate. The overlord chuckled at his little elf eagerness to move forward, he too wanted to finally face this fool that surely wielded some power. A worthy challenge at last, he thought as he let himself be pulled by Irithriel towards the door that was being easily carved by the hunter. "Impressive..." He commented after seeing the big hole Uthal had managed to carve. "We shall find you a weapon made to break obstacles such as this." Mors told the other giant after reaching him and noticing the damaged weapon of the barbarian. He would never be so impulsive like the other Goliath, a good overlord knew how to study the battlefield and command his army in the best way... But he would never denied the results of Uthal more primal tactics. Still, Mors would wait until this challenge nwas completed before casting his judgement on this hunter... And the strange woman too. He had seen a glimpse of her small solder and her in the last battle, not overly strong but she could strike on the vital points of the enemies and make them fall. So far these two and the warden were the ones he was considering in recruiting for his army, but for now he would wait and see their strength and weaknesses before he made a decision.
Mors | Garg | Bof 22-May-20 05:08 PM
Scene
As the party went into the castle, they all heard a voice, it was distinctly female and it carried a soft but still eerie tone to it. "Come... We have been waiting... For the guests of honor...." The big stone building seemed to be in different states of decay, all but the main path leading towards the throne room. It was easy to follow thanks to the lit torches of dark blue fire leading the way. "It has been... So long...." The more they approached, the more unnatural the atmosphere felt to them. "Death has tried... And failed... Are you... Death champions?" Finally they reached the only supposed 'living' creatures in the castle.
Sitting in the throne was a big man and on his lap a woman, the one that was speaking to them. "Here... At last..."
Mors | Garg | Bof 22-May-20 08:27 PM
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 22-May-20 08:45 PM
Irithriel wasn’t liking the way her skin suddenly crawled, as that voice slid over her skin. There was something strange... off... and her inquisitive nature needed to know more. Being of noble birth, after all, she was a Phiarlan elf by blood, she could recall enough of the preferred manner the fey and other high born elves at court seemed to like. “Good evening,” Iri then spoke, taking a few steps ahead before curtsying low. She remained lowered, eyes cast down. “To whom do we have the honor?” she asked. “You are our hosts, yet we have not had formal introduction.” As Iri kept her gray eyes fixed on the stony floor, she wondered if this was the count and... dare she think it! His lost love. Undead. Waiting. “I am Irithriel Ravenwood, a Phiarlan child and elf of the same noble house. These are my friends.” As she spoke, she hoped she was making her Mors proud. “To whom do we address ourselves. Our apologies for being unaware. Also...” Her voice trailed a moment. “Forgive us, could you explain what a Death Champion might be?”
Delielah/Abby 22-May-20 08:59 PM
Delielah would be looking the count and woman with suspicion, she kept herself in a wary manner, it certainly was clear who was the big spoon in that relationship, but it begs the question, why are the undead attempting to kill another undead? This would boggle Delielah's might for a bit as she stays quiet and observes, it was clear she had misread the situation entirely.
Mors | Garg | Bof 23-May-20 12:59 AM
The strange pair remained unmoving on the throne until a few seconds after Irithriel finished asking her questions something happened. The torches lighting the hall, flickered and the woman started to float and hover around the big sitting man. "A life taken from death... The balance was broken... Death seeks to reclaim... A champion shall be death's hand..." By this point the woman was sitting on the man's shoulders, her dress looked like she was underwater. "Come death's champion... Reclaim the what was taken away..." All the while, the man remained silent on his throne, his eyes never leaving the sight of the party.
Mors | Garg | Bof 23-May-20 01:07 AM
Mors
Mors scowled, the expression hidden by his helmet like always. He would have already started to attack these fools if it weren't for his mate wanting to ask her questions. If this whole thing weren't a simulation made by the metal man, he would be already be on the process of taking this place for himself. Also, he didn't care about this death's business. After all, he had conquered death by himself... Twice. He just wanted a worthy challenge and all the signs pontied towards that strange pair. But for now. He will wait and watch. Only a fool would charge without having an idea about the enemy's might and his mate had made an acceptable choice by trying to get these fools to spill their secrets. "I am no champion... I am the thing Kings and Queens need champions for..." He grumbled under his breath, the same words he had told the hunter not long ago.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 23-May-20 01:49 AM
Uthal paused as Irithriel asked her question; it was rather odd to introduce oneself to someone that just tried to kill them. But...Perhaps it was her people's way of learning about why people acted the way they did. To him, it did not really matter; much like Mors, he did not care what this 'death' business was. Even so, he was even more confused when the woman responded; what did she mean by 'Death's Champion'? Did she refer to Mors? To the man on the throne? But then he felt a twinge in his body, leftover artifacts of the wight's power. It was like...It was pulling him towards the throne. More of a suggestion than anything, but....This was meant for all them. "I think she means all of us, Mors. She believes us to be champions of Death...Likely due to the hordes we destroyed." Uthal replied, adding "I do not much care for these politics...." He then spoke up more loudly, allowing his voice to carry, "If it is absolution you seek for your error, then end your life with your own hand, coward!"
Delielah/Abby 23-May-20 05:17 AM
Delielah felt some real dodgy vibes from this undead woman, from her tone it was like she wanted to die, but that's what made it feel so... Provocative. Delielah bit her lip as prepare to cast a simple cantrip, one of her few offensive options at this point in time, "I don't trust this one bit..." The hoodling would be watching the pair, readying itself for an epic fight.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 23-May-20 09:08 PM

At that, she huffed a small pout and looked over at the two. Her gray eyes narrowed, while her body rose back to full upright position. I asked.” The pretty elf stomped her foot, a mild tantrum, her lower lip jutting out, as she sulked. “I think that’s the count and his dead love, but....” Her snowy head tilted a little. “Something seems wrong about that some how...”
Delielah/Abby 23-May-20 10:34 PM

Mors | Garg | Bof 24-May-20 08:50 AM
Mors
Mors listened to the Hunter's words and got more and more angry, enough so his markings started to glow once again, making the same green that come from his eyes appear under his armor. These fools dared to challenge our might? He thought and was about to raise his hammer to fire a blast of his power when his mate walked back towards him. Despite his angry state, he chuckled a little after seeing Iri's little tantrum. "Don't worry little moon, we will show these fools the concecuences of disrespecting us." He told her softly before noticing the other woman leaning to say something to her, so he just looked at the fools and took a few steps forward. He raised his hammer and let his power flow through it, making it glow too. "You fools, you have awakened something greater than death. Now... Now we shall show you our might and you will wish to end your lives yourselves!!" He roared to them, his voice eachoing with dark power and he focused his glowing eyes in the woman, trying to strike fear into her and show her the mistake she had made by challenging them.
Mors | Garg | Bof 24-May-20 09:00 AM
Scene
As soon as Mors roared to the woman, she visibly jumped in the air and her body became see through like an specter. She made a loud wail and floated towards the big man's back, trying to hide from the frightening overlord. However this had the opposite effect on the man. He quickly smashed his fist on the big throne armrest and broke a piece off it. "You... Dare!!" He roared back and something started to happen to him. It was like an illusion covering his body started to slowly dissapear and reveal his true form. A big armored spectre, looking similar to Mors.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 24-May-20 11:43 AM
Uthal just watched as the overlord got enraged; it was a very bad idea to disrespect the mate of a Goliath. Something the specterly woman would come to find out herself; Uthal saw the truth of their bond in this moment. They were inseparable, and he happened to overhear the words of the one named Delielah. "It seems she also has yet to learn respect." he would say, keeping his blade upwardly raised, referring to the woman upon the silent man's shoulders. And it seemed Mors' words had a great effect indeed, the man now the one enraged; good. This could make him sloppy, and it seemed the woman was rather shaken by Mors' angry outburst. "Well, he seems more lively now. I was worried he would take my advice about ending his own life seriously." Uthal said, coming to stand beside his Goliath friend. He did not have the armor or the magical abilities of Mors, but he was still a Goliath true and through; he would not lack for spirit in this fight. Especially now that their opponent seemed rather serious. "Now then, if you truly wish to exact your anger for being called out on your cowardice, then come at us fool!" Uthal shouted to the giant armored spectre.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 25-May-20 09:08 AM
The sudden eruption of emotion, followed by the transformation of whom she was certain was the count, Irithriel felt her muscles tighten, her gray eyes going wide. Touching her belly, the girl suddenly drew a sigil, a soft glow wrapping itself about her body before fading. She knew it wasn’t much, but she also figured it wouldn’t hurt to protect her unborn child a little since she could. After Iri’s ward was set, she wondered just what was going on between that strange pair. The woman was obviously a ghost. But the man? The people in the village hadn’t mentioned that he was anything but human. Perhaps there was much more going on that they didn’t know. Just what was this count? He was definitely not human. At least, not anymore. Trying to further assess things, she was at least glad that her Mors had managed to frighten the ethereal being.

Uthal grunted from the pain as the count struck him; he had charged so suddenly and violently he was caught off-guard. His body staggered from the force of the blow, feeling his bones creak and several small fissures appear on his stony skin. He'd made him bleed...Now it was his turn to do the same. "He will not live long enough to see his error!" Irithriel has been watching everyone, her senses reeling, as she tried her best to aim. But then... once more... the count fell. The girl gasped softly then, lowering her weapon just a bit. She glanced that horrific woman out of the corner of her eye, Lonehunter doing his best to keep her occupied. “Right,” Iri then whispered, marching over to where that dishonorable count lay crumpled on the ground. She looked at her arrow, the tip ablaze in blue flame. In the moment, she held it up and over his body. “This is for hurting my allies, my minions and, most especially, my Mors.” At that, she brought the blue-flamed arrow down and stabbed it right into his unmoving body. With bated breath, she waited to see if he’d dare to rise once more.
Mors | Garg | Bof 27-May-20 03:46 PM
The undead body lighted in flue fire and this time the undead count stopped coming back...
Delielah/Abby 27-May-20 04:12 PM
Seeing the Count die, Delielah would turn her attention to the ghost, aiming her crossbow at the spirit, shoot her with the bolt. The hoodling would stand on the count's body to check if he was truly dead.
Mors | Garg | Bof 27-May-20 06:06 PM
The hoodlings robe got lit on fire, causing him some damage but little by little starting to get worse. Mors had watched his mate get the fool on fire and he smiled with pride, the expression being hidden by his helmet. He was about to say something to her when he heard the woman screeching once again and he quickly turned around and fired a couple of blasts from his hammer. "Go!" He told his minions. He wasn't sure if the fool would gi again if it happened he would just pummel him to the ground once again.
The green minions nodded after hearing more orders and dashed towards the ghostly woman that was locked in battle with Uthal.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 28-May-20 11:47 AM
The banshee reeled as Mors' powerful magics rattled and eviscerated her, her body bleeding badly. And made worse when Delielah's bolt pierced through her neck. But it seemed fate wished Uthal to deliver the final strike, the giant raising his dulled Weapon, point facing towards her...And shoving it through her chest, the blunted weapon piercing her through her back. However, he was not down; he then brought it down over his head and slammed her ethereal corpse into the hard floor. He'd never really faced undead before...But was glad he was amongst those that clearly had some knowledge in fighting them. And as the minions might make their way over, the banshee had been defeated; though stared intently at her. His body tensed, the power of the Mountain Bear still coursing through him and fighting against the wight's energies. Pulling back his sword, his eyes never left the undead creature, his powerful chest rising and falling in anticipation; almost like...he was waiting for it to return as the count had done. Even with the injuries he'd sustained, he was ready for more.
Mors | Garg | Bof 28-May-20 11:59 AM
The ghostly body of the woman exploded in an extreme gust of wind, strong enough to put out all the blue flamies and leaving the whole throne room in complete darkness. After a few seconds something started to happen... A yellow glow started to come from the throne, getting stronger by the second until it was too bright to see. Then the light exploded and it was like an illusion was broken on the castle. No longer it was old and decayed but now it looked like a normal human castle should look. Standing in front of the group was a man and he had a glowing woman hovering besides him. "I thank you, death's champion.... You have broken our bondage to death and restored the balance...." (edited)
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 28-May-20 12:10 PM
Uthal reeled back as the woman exploded, cursing loudly in Giant as the room was plunged into blackness. "More!? Good, I am not done yet!" Uthal shouted; though as the glow began to intensify, he first turned towards it, but then had to shield his eyes before the glow too detonated. He did not notice the castle's remade appearance, only that two more figures had appeared. Broken the bondage to death? So they were too weak to escape then. Uthal was still fairly juvenile and his own intense training in the body had left his mind lacking at times, especially after the use of his contract with the Stone Bear of the Mountains. "I see dying twice has left you thirsting for more...Good! I haven't finished killing you yet!" Uthal shouted, beginning to stride towards the glowing pair without realizing what they might actually be here for.

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 29-May-20 01:43 AM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 29-May-20 08:19 PM

Mors | Garg | Bof 29-May-20 09:04 PM
"Interesting" Came from the man. "Not disappointing but still a long way from perfect." As he spoke more and more the whole throne room started to change until it was once again the training hall and in the place where the man had been was the battle master in all his metallic glory and he was holding a steamy mug with a very dark and oily liquid. Probably was actually oil since he was a warforged. He waited a few second to let Mors and Irithriel turn around to see him and then he threw the contents of his mug on the burning hoodling, covering it in the oily liquid and leaving it only smoking. "Good combo fighting with your minion succubus but leaving it behind even with the others was a very foolish move, very disappointing coming from an overlord with only one minion to take hits for her." As he scolded Delielah his voice stopped echoing around the rooms and returned to be his usual mechanical one. "Speaking of overlords, the green ones and the blue one did better this time around but still, you left them out of the fight most of the time and that move of using one as a meat shield was very... dissaponting and foolish., you could have thrown your shield instead." he said while shaking his head. Despite that it seemed that he was in a light mood since his scowling was not being as severe as usual.
Then he shook his mug and it magically got refilled so he could take a sip of hot liquid and then he turned towards Irithiel. "Good move on gathering knowledge on the battlefield while leaving the more martial ones to deal with the weak hordes. Bad move on using so much power on healing Mors. He was still slightly wounded, nothing serious and you could have used that on a more severe case... Also, you got the story wrong. Still good enough to point the others towards the castle... And you need more training with that bow, magic is always limited and there will be a day when you will need to use only your body to protect the little one." He explained with an even softer voice and his eyes showed some pride in them after seeing her growth since last time. "And you raging barbarian, you need to use your brain more. If you don't want to, then ask for help and let others point you towards where you need to be to cause the most damage to the enemy. And for everithing that was metal in the planes... Never again insult your weapon in that way again, you could have borrowed the other goliath's hammer and used it to get the path open in an easier way, no lasting damage. Even strong beasts work in packs... and a weapon is like your own claws, a deadly extension of your own body... If you break your body you will be useless even before you face your first young dragon, remember that." He finally addressed Uthal before turning around and starting to walk towards his office. "All in all... A decent show of teamwork. Now, it's late and you have been there for a while. Go and fuck around like you fleshbags are probably dying to... you earned it." The battle master departing words were as callous as ever but even then he sounded pleased with what he had seen today in his training hall.
Delielah/Abby 29-May-20 09:08 PM

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 29-May-20 10:45 PM
Uthal watched as the room dissolved back into normal, hearing the voice of the Tower as he began to explain the weaknesses in their style. Uthal knew there were mistakes he had made; that was just part of living. But it was the strong who learned from them, and used those lessons to grow and survive. The weak believed they were perfect and stopped growing; it was how only the hardiest of stones would become mountains, and the weaker rock would fade into dust. Much could be learned by watching the world. At the warforged's comments about his blade, he looked down at the edged weapon; indeed, it had taken a beating in his eagerness to clear the way for his allies. He would never take another's weapon, unless it was a hostile and he was seeking to disarm them. Mors too had said something similar; he did have a smaller hammer with him. But it would have taken too long, and honestly? He'd forgotten it was a simulation, especially since he was still hurting from his wounds. Non-mortal as they were. Even so, he would take the warforged's advice to heart; he was a warrior, strong and proud. There was no need for tactics in his mind; only the heated honor of glorious battle. "I will pass...I must go have my weapon sharpened." he would say, adding "But you did well today, as the Tower had said." He then would address the others, "I would be proud to call any of you clansmen." (edited)

Bofwant BOT 17-Jul-20 02:51 PM

After what happened..." He sighed and shook his head. "This had been a long time coming. If I had trained my own power more, I would have been able to handle such intensity of radiance but now it's like my veins have been cleansed, the paths for magic opened." He tried to explain. He could feel it, how his power had become stronger... Well, it was already strong but now he could channel it in greater quantities. "I won't let that happen to me again. From now on I will train more with my power, learn to handle what is inside me so it won't harm me or others... Even if I don't like to rely on it." He finished while looking around the empty training hall. For now they needed to wait for Mr. Vanilor and then he was sure that the exercise will start when they are ready for it. He still didn't understand how Mr. Tower does it, but he had perfect timing for starting the training hall simulations.
Vanilor BOT 20-Jul-20 02:19 AM
After a short wait for the pair Vanilor emerged from the hallway in a slow and calm walk. On his face he bore the same calm composure and faint smile, though his garments had changed to one slightly lighter. His jacket had been abandoned in his room and he was left wearing a white tunic. Noticeably under each of his arms were matching silver revolvers which were strapped securely into leather shoulder holsters that fit snugly under his armpits. Stepping forward Vanilor admired the room, then turned to face the pair. “I apologize for the wait.. I must say; I was expecting something much more— Simple.”

Dungeon Master BOT 20-Jul-20 02:34 PM
After Vanilor and the dancer entered the training hall, the whole room started to transform. Slowly, like an illusion was being erected around the group their reality was altered. Cold metal floor turned into dirt and soft grass, trees sprouted from the ground straight into the sky. The sounds of nature quickly filled the silence, leaving the four guild members in the middle of a forest. The sun was high in the sky but the high trees greedily swallowed all the light, only allowing a few to pass through and iluminante the ground below.

Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 20-Jul-20 08:08 PM

The red head expected as much, after all, similar had happened when she and Bofwant has trained before. Slowly, the room shifted and changed and it wasn’t long before it felt as if they were surrounded by the dark shadows of a lush forest. “Yes, this is normal,” Sela whispered, her words for Vanilor, as much as for Juma. “We’ve trained one here before. I wonder what Mr Iron Tower has in store for us this time...” she mumbled, her golden eyes glancing around, a strange magical energy seeming to crackle through her veins—Jarreth’s magic. Pact magic. She just hoped she’d be able to control it.
Vanilor BOT 21-Jul-20 08:03 AM
Vanilors questions and concerns of how their training would proceed quickly subsided and turned to awe-struck after the imagery of the room had begun to flicker and change. Vanilor smiled to the newcomer Juma briefly after the others addressed her and for a brief moment locked his black eyes with hers; then his attention turned back to the forestry and their new surroundings.
”Its quite— beautiful.” Vanilor said; his gaping jaw revealing his overwhelming interest. “Who is this “Mr. Iron Tower” you speak of?”

Dungeon Master BOT 21-Jul-20 02:40 PM
Just then, a couple of arrows pierced the quietness of the forest. One passing dangerously close to Sela and Bofwant heads and the other embedding itself a few feet on the tree behind (north) of juma.
Vanilor BOT 21-Jul-20 03:17 PM
Vanilor didn't bother to respond to Bofwant, it was clear by the projectiles whizzing by that the training had begun and instead he lowered himself into a crouched stance and with his dominant hand retrieved the revolver out of its leather holster under his left armpit. He slid the palm of his left hand against the cylinder of the revolver in a flash of a motion and watched while the various symbols engraved in the cartridges flickered by in a blur. The cylinder came to a halt exactly where he had intended, a small but noticeable flame engraved in the bullet which stopped in the firing position. He pulled back the pin of the revolver and lifted his hand in the direction in which the arrows had come from. He briefly checked over each of his shoulders to make sure his companions were behind him and out of the crossfire; then he pulled the trigger. A mote of fire emerged from the barrel of the revolver and coned outwards towards the treeline; an inaccurate shot but he hoped the flames would engulf the treeline and at least cause cover for him and his companions, if not harm their attackers.
Juma/Melmie/Kalosha 21-Jul-20 05:06 PM

Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 21-Jul-20 06:07 PM
Sela’s eyes widened the moment she heard the familiar sound of arrows moving through the air. Her golden eyes noted where they struck the nearby tree, giving the red headed elf an idea of where the assailants might be. Deciding then to yoke her strengths, she immediately sought the comfort and familiarity of the shadows and managed to hide behind a nearby fallen tree. Once in her chosen spot, she peered out into the dark forest, her bow at the ready.

Dungeon Master BOT 21-Jul-20 08:22 PM

The little light of the medium sized flames chased away the shadows of the nearby area but they didn't reveal the silent attackers. A few seconds of silence passed before more arrows fell upon them. Bofwant BOT 21-Jul-20 08:30 PM
The healer grunted in pain, first at the impact of the first projectile against his shield and then at the second one that pierced his armor. "No weapon formed against you shall prosper..." His holy power flowing through him and making his armor light up a little in radiance, providing some magical protection.
Vanilor BOT 22-Jul-20 12:35 AM
Vanilor watched in amazement as Bofwant stepped forward with his glistening armor and blocked the array of arrows which would have likely hit him or Juma whom was standing not far behind. For a moment he was motionless, and he couldn't help but feel foolish for leaving himself so exposed; and in turn causing Bofwant to take damage. Vanilor did just as Bofwant instructed and found the closest cover he could; He positioned himself directly behind Bofwant and stayed on his rear while the large healer charged forward. He knew he was no where near as strong as Bofwant and in normal circumstances he would not have done something so reckless, though the fact it was a simulation put Vanilor in a form of tranquility; more importantly he wanted to impress those present, or at the very least show them he was courageous. After arriving at the tree and nearly face planting into the back of Bofwants armour, Vanilor quickly assessed it wasn't big enough cover for the pair. He remembered seeing the shadowy figures fleeing from the tree-top he lit ablaze. "I'm going further, I'll use the smoke as cover.." He said, and then without giving Bofwant time to argue he charged to the east towards the tree with its upper half still engulfed in flames; hoping the smoke was dense enough to cover for him to slip past unnoticed.
Dungeon Master BOT 23-Jul-20 08:56 AM

As Sela held her bow at the ready, she glanced the area to see what was shooting those arrows. Trying to keep her breath steady, the girl decided the scout was her best chance, so she darted out from behind the fallen tree and let her own arrow move through air. The thing managed to find itself sinking deep into the scout’s flesh, causing them to feel just how much power an arrow could have under the right circumstances. Sela gasped softly, not expecting her action to do quite so much damage. However, she hoped it proved helpful in this battle. Knowing she was exposed where she was, the red head then moved back behind the safe covering of the fallen down tree.

Dungeon Master BOT 23-Jul-20 04:55 PM

Vanilor BOT 23-Jul-20 06:00 PM
The arrow whizzed over Vanilors shoulder and past his ear in a violent hiss, piercing itself into the tree a mere few inches from his face; and the thought of death creeped into his mind. It had been some time since Vanilor had been faced with combat, real or faux. His muscles tensed and he couldn’t help but freeze in his tracks behind the tree, his eyes slowly scanned over his companions and whatever threats they faced, if he were able to see them. After what seemed like a minute but was only a split second Vanilor looked back at Bofwant with a empty expression, as if he was lost or in disarray. Vanilor saw Bofwants lips moving but could hear nothing but the faint ringing in his ears. Then; after closing his eyes and reopening them his senses returned in time for him to hear Bofwants next call out. “I know few spells that prove useful in combat, but I will do my best Bofwant.” He said in a confident voice followed by an affirmative nod, whatever once troubled him had clearly passed.
Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 23-Jul-20 10:04 PM
Sela saw the scout retreat, but she’d also heard Bofwant call out and direct attention towards the rushing orc. For a brief moment, the girl felt her fear wash over her entirely, her breaths coming quickly, while she tried to remain calm. “You... you can do this...” she whispered, a small pep talk to keep herself grounded. Just then, she moved out from the cover of the fallen tree, aimed her arrow at the oncoming orc, and then let the arrow fly. Not waiting to see what happened, the red headed elf moved back into the safety of the cover of that fallen tree, though her ears couldn’t miss the wet sound of arrow piercing flesh, as it sunk into the charging orc’s body.

Vanilor BOT 24-Jul-20 03:53 PM

He groaned in agony, surprised to feel such things from a simulation. He didn’t hesitate or take time to inspect or tend to his wound, instead he shot into motion and attempted to backtrack to the north-east in an attempt to cut off the Scout. He was aware that the scout was attempting to flank behind him and his companions, and knew he’d be leaving his new friends open to be hit by arrows if he didn’t intervene; which he had recently found out. Once behind the cover of the tree Vanilor retrieved the revolver from his limp right hand and spun the cylinder until it landed on the bullet he desired. After readying himself he peered around the tree to try and spot the scout; which a portion of was visible from the angle he had; so he slowly and quietly leaned around the tree and lifted his revolver to aim.
Vanilor BOT 24-Jul-20 04:59 PM

Vanilor BOT 26-Jul-20 03:13 PM

He slowly reached up with his left and and grabbed the shaft of the javelin and pulled it straight out, unable to resist screaming out in agony. While blood rolled down his arm and pooped up in his hand, though he ignored it as best he could and used his thigh to rotate the cylinder to the desired cartridge. When he looked up it was in time to see two arrows each coming towards his location. Channeling his magic through the wooden pommel of his revolver he casted Shield, which deflected the arrows and caused them to fall short. Then he faced the Orc which was closing distance on him quickly. He rose his right hand as it shook violently, hardly able to hold the revolver still.. then pulled the trigger after lining it up with the Orcs chest. Which engulfed him in flames and gave Vanilor an opening to move in the disarray, though his injuries slowed his movements ten fold.
It took Vanilor some time but eventually he made it behind the cover of an elder tree, where he lowered himself onto his bottom and planted his back against the tree. There he presses a hand against his wound and rested.

Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 26-Jul-20 04:29 PM
Sela’s fear threatened to take over once more, as she watched the bloodbath unfold before her very eyes. Only once in her life had she been happy to see blood spilled. And that was the night she and Barachiel had found their parents mutilated. Dismembered. Puddles of crimson staining the floors. But that shiver of delight, that taste of freedom was short lived when her twin was torn away from her life by those large blue hands. For a brief moment, Sela forgot that her scar had been taken away by Jarreth, a finger tracing it before she set her jaw and raced to Vanilor’s side. “Shh... shh...” she whispered, immediately doing as Bofwant had shown her she could do. The girl quickly dressed his wounds, staving off the quick flow of blood. He’d still be in pain, but he was stable. Able to move or fight or defend. It was all she could, as the orc shouted in anger. Gasping softly, Sela then moved to the nearby tree just north of Vanilor. Close enough to help him again, and a bit safer in those warm and lovely shadows cast by the leafy lush tree.

Such was the power Bofwant used that all of Vanilor wounds were closed, broken bones mended and blood was replenished. Even the foreign objects piercing him were magically pushed out as his skin mended and he regained his full health with the added effect of the injection helping him go back to action with renewed strength.

He moved through the foresty with ease, taking advantage of the new stamina that surged throughout his body. Bofwant BOT 27-Jul-20 08:45 PM

The strong painkillers quickly working in him and making him stop feeling the pain of his wounds. He tested his leg and shoulder. Everything felt fine and there was no bleeding. Ready to go again the Healer stood up and moved to a better position to be ready for the second wave of enemies. Vanilor BOT 28-Jul-20 07:18 PM

Vanilor took the time to load another cartridge infused with the ingredients to cast Fire Bolt and attempted to fire the cantrip at the Big Orc though he miscalculated and failed to connect. He cussed under his breathe; wanting to insult the revolver but knowing it was the operators fault. He was considering fleeing when he spotted a nice perch high above in the tree, and rather than moving back he ascended the tree and sat on a branch fifteen feet in the air, awaiting the opportunity to strike.
Bofwant BOT 28-Jul-20 07:25 PM
Bofwant groaned at the strength he had to use to push back the deadly tusks of the mount and avoid being impaled. He gathered even more strength before swinging his sword upwards, the opening he had made paid off and his sharp weapon carved the beast's flesh. Once again as soon as he made contact he pulled from within that holy power of his and unloaded it on his enemy, burning the boar with radiant power and causing the wound to be worse. Then the soldier tried to bring the raised sword down for a second hit but the boar had been trained for combat and parried the strike with one big tusk in a very impressive way.
Dungeon Master BOT 28-Jul-20 07:27 PM
The beast squealed in anger and was about to try to impale the armored man again but just then Juma attacked from behind. Even if it's hide was too thick for the attacks to do damage, they were enough to distract the boar and allow the soldier to once again block the deadly attack.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 28-Jul-20 07:59 PM
Sela watched everyone give it their all, the girl noticing her love, as he fought valiantly against those terrible orc swarm. She then sucked in a breath, bow steady, as she let an arrow fly. It sailed across the clearing, finding its home in the big orc’s arm. In that moment, she exhaled. This wasn’t over yet, but every bit of effort helped. Satisfied with her contribution, the girl slunk back into those shadows and then moved around the tree. As she took the moment to reassess, she decided it best not to move too far from everyone, but to also use the natural protection and cover the nearby tree could provide.
Dungeon Master BOT 28-Jul-20 08:43 PM
The big orc kept moving forward, eyes trained on the climbing tiefling. He felt the arrow pierce his arm but such was his tunnel vision that he dismissed it completely. "You are dead demon!! Running away will do nothing!!!" He roared as he took aim and threw his spear at the tiefling with all his strength. The weapon flew and impaled the recently healed Vanilor, such as the force that he couldn't hold onto the tree and fell down. Even if he was 15ft up the ground below nwss full of leaves and bushes so his fall was not as painful as it could have been but it still did some damage to him, probably a broken rib or two.
Juma/Melmie/Kalosha 28-Jul-20 08:52 PM
The Dancer tried to attack the big boar once more... but seems like her weapons weren't enough to pierce the thick hide of this animal... What the hell was this?
Vanilor BOT 28-Jul-20 09:28 PM
Vanilor had been climbing the large tree when a javelin had come flying in his direction, it shattered through various branches and sent fragments towards him which cut at his cheeks; though it mattered little compared to the Javelin which impaled itself in Vanilors shoulder and launched him from the tree; ironically the opposite shoulder as his last encounter with such a weapon. The fifteen foot fall from the tree gave Vanilor enough time to aim and attempt to launch another Fire Bolt at the Big Orc; though being upside down helped his aim little and he missed by a fair distance. He managed to rotate mid air enough to land in a non-lethal way, though he almost felt his knees give out as they buckled to absorb the impact.
He moved to a distance not far with intentions of separating himself from the fight long enough to survive, though the javelin and his injuries made his movements slow and sluggish.
Bofwant BOT 28-Jul-20 09:53 PM
Bofwant had enough of this beast. Specially with that big orc screaming after Vanilor. When Juma attacked the beast, even if it didn't to any real damage to it, a opening was provided for the soldier and he took it. Bofwant made two big swings, both carving the flesh of the boar and the last one charged with magic once again. It was just too much, the beast falling dead thanks to the relentless assault. But he didn't stop there, as soon as he saw the life leave the boar he turned on his heel and rushed towards the Orc, trying to cover for Vanilor. "Your opponent is me now!!!" Screamed the healer with the hopes of taking the heat off the tiefling.
Selaphiel Rookwood BOT 28-Jul-20 10:10 PM
While more continued fo unfold, Sela darted our from behind the tree and attempted to let another arrow find its way to the big orc. But in her eagerness to aid, the arrow went wide and missed. For a moment, she thought she might have been spotted. However, it didn’t take long for her to realize she was still safe from prying eyes. Using that to her advantage, she raced towards a hiding space she saw beckoning her home... the perfect place between a tree and a fallen one.
Dungeon Master BOT 28-Jul-20 10:18 PM
The big orc roared at Bofwant. "Get out if the way!!! That demon is mine!!!" And attacked him with his greataxe. The soldier had to party with his sword, thing that made the perfect opening for the orc to dash away towards the hurt tiefling. As soon as he was in range, the Orc tried to cut Vanilor in half using his greataxe but he had ignored Sela's previous arrow and his arm failed him. The heavy weapon went sideways and embedded itself in the tree, braking the Orc's momentum and causing him to slip on the fallen leaves and fall on his ass like a fool.
Juma/Melmie/Kalosha 28-Jul-20 10:50 PM
Moving like the wind across the forest, Juma made her way towards her next target with her shortswords on her hands.
